analyzed: 'od thams cad kyi 'byung gnas su gyur pa ste /
translated: He is the source of all lights.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi 'od kyi rgyan mchog dam pa bla na med pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi 'od kyi rgyan mchog dam pa bla na med pa'o //
translated: This is the supreme, highest, and most excellent adornment of the light of the blessed buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni kha dog mtha' yas pa mnga' ba ste /🔽kha dog yid du 'ong ba mnga' ba'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni kha dog mtha' yas pa mnga' ba ste / kha dog yid du 'ong ba mnga' ba'o //
translated: “The blessed buddhas have an infinite number of colors.🔽They have a pleasant color.

original: kha dog 'od gsal ba mnga' ba'o //
analyzed: kha dog 'od gsal ba mnga' ba'o //
translated: They have a radiant color.

original: kha dog tshad med pa mnga' ba'o //
analyzed: kha dog tshad med pa mnga' ba'o //
translated: They have an immeasurable color.

original: sems can gyi khams ma lus pa thams cad kyi bsam pa dang mos pa bzhin du rnam par dmigs pa'i kha dog mnga' ba'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi khams ma lus pa thams cad kyi bsam pa dang mos pa bzhin du rnam par dmigs pa'i kha dog mnga' ba'o //
translated: They have a color that is perceived in accordance with the wishes and aspirations of all sentient beings without exception.

original: de ma yin pa'i kha dog gzhan khams gsum du gtogs pa thams cad zil gyis @19a *//
analyzed: de ma yin pa'i kha dog gzhan khams gsum du gtogs pa thams cad zil gyis @19a *//
translated: All other colors belonging to the three realms are outshone by the color of the Buddha’s body.🔽

original: gnon pa'i kha dog mnga' ba'o //
analyzed: gnon pa'i kha dog mnga' ba'o //
translated: He has the color that surpasses all other colors that belong to the three realms.🔽He has attained the perfection of all colors.

original: kha dog thams cad kyi pha rol tu phyin pa brnyes pas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni kha dog bla na med pa mnga' ba ste /
analyzed: kha dog thams cad kyi pha rol tu phyin pa brnyes pas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni kha dog bla na med pa mnga' ba ste /
translated: The Blessed Buddhas have the unsurpassed color.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi kha dog gi rgyan mchog dam pa bla na med pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi kha dog gi rgyan mchog dam pa bla na med pa'o //
translated: This is the supreme, sublime ornament of color of the Blessed Buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni dge bas shin tu rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni dge bas shin tu rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: The Blessed Buddhas are extremely pure due to their virtue.

original: 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rigs dge ba rin po che'i 'byung gnas su gyur pa la shin tu byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rigs dge ba rin po che'i 'byung gnas su gyur pa la shin tu byung ba'o //
translated: They are the source of the precious family of virtue of all the Buddhas of the past, present, and future.

original: chos nyid kyi rnam pa thams cad du khyad par yod pa dang / khyad par med pa'i spyod pas rnam par dag pa'i rgyan gyi ye shes skye ba thams cad kyi nang du gtogs pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs bsgribs pa med pa'i rgyud rnam par dag pas 'jig rten gyi mi snyan pa thams cad kyis mi snyan pa brjod du med pa ste /
analyzed: chos nyid kyi rnam pa thams cad du khyad par yod pa dang / khyad par med pa'i spyod pas rnam par dag pa'i rgyan gyi ye shes skye ba thams cad kyi nang du gtogs pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs bsgribs pa med pa'i rgyud rnam par dag pas 'jig rten gyi mi snyan pa thams cad kyis mi snyan pa brjod du med pa ste /
translated: The Tathāgata’s lineage is pure and unobscured, and so it is beyond all worldly unpleasantness and beyond all unpleasant speech.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi rigs dang rgyud rnam par dag pa'i rgyan mchog dam pa bla na med pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi rigs dang rgyud rnam par dag pa'i rgyan mchog dam pa bla na med pa'o //
translated: This is the supreme, highest, pure ornament of the lineage and continuity of the Blessed Buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni byams pa chen po'i mthu dang / rang bzhin gyi rgyan mnga' ba ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni byams pa chen po'i mthu dang / rang bzhin gyi rgyan mnga' ba ste /
translated: The Blessed Buddhas have the power of great love and the natural ornament.

original: shin tu dang ba yongs su rtog pa'i rnyog pa mi mnga' ba sku'i 'phrin las yongs su gsal ba /
analyzed: shin tu dang ba yongs su rtog pa'i rnyog pa mi mnga' ba sku'i 'phrin las yongs su gsal ba /
translated: They have very clear physical activity.

original: blta bas mi skyo ba /
analyzed: blta bas mi skyo ba /
translated: They are never tired of being looked at.

original: thugs shin tu rnam par gsal ba /
analyzed: thugs shin tu rnam par gsal ba /
translated: They have very clear minds.

original: thugs rje chen po mnga' ba /
analyzed: thugs rje chen po mnga' ba /
translated: He is endowed with great compassion.

original: 'gro ba thams cad skyo ba pa yon gyi gnas kyi dam pa /
analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad skyo ba pa yon gyi gnas kyi dam pa /
translated: He is the supreme object of offering for all beings.

original: bla na med pa @19b yongs su 'dzin pa'i nang na thugs brtse ba can phan par mdzad pa /
analyzed: bla na med pa @19b yongs su 'dzin pa'i nang na thugs brtse ba can phan par mdzad pa /
translated: He is the most compassionate and beneficial among all those who hold the unsurpassed.

original: sems can thams cad kyi don du ye shes chen po byin gyis brlabs te /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi don du ye shes chen po byin gyis brlabs te /
translated: He has blessed his great wisdom for the sake of all sentient beings.

original: bsod nams chen pos yongs su 'phags pa /
analyzed: bsod nams chen pos yongs su 'phags pa /
translated: He is exalted by great merit.

original: 'gro ba thams cad kyi bsod nams kyi zhing du gyur pa /
analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad kyi bsod nams kyi zhing du gyur pa /
translated: He is the field of merit for all beings.

original: sems can rnams kyi yon tan dang / ye shes kyi phung po thams cad rnam par 'phel bar mdzad pa ste /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi yon tan dang / ye shes kyi phung po thams cad rnam par 'phel bar mdzad pa ste /
translated: He causes the increase of all the aggregates of qualities and wisdom of sentient beings.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi byams pa chen po dang / thugs rje chen po'i mthar thug pa'i bsod nams kyi rgyan mchog dam pa bla na med pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi byams pa chen po dang / thugs rje chen po'i mthar thug pa'i bsod nams kyi rgyan mchog dam pa bla na med pa'o //
translated: This is the supreme, sublime, unsurpassed, and ultimate ornament of merit of the blessed buddhas, their great love and great compassion.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: “O son of the victors!

original: bcu po de dag ni /
analyzed: bcu po de dag ni /
translated: These are the ten.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi rgyan mchog dam pa bla na med pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi rgyan mchog dam pa bla na med pa'o //
translated: It is the supreme, highest, and most excellent ornament of the buddhas, the transcendent conquerors.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: “O son of the conquerors!

original: bcu po 'di dag ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi mnga' chen pos mnga' bsgyur ba'i chos rnams te /
analyzed: bcu po 'di dag ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi mnga' chen pos mnga' bsgyur ba'i chos rnams te /
translated: There are ten qualities that are the great powers of the buddhas, the transcendent conquerors.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten?

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni chos thams cad la mnga' ba dang / chos thams cad la snang bar mdzad pa'i mnga' bsgyur bas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni chos thams cad la mnga' ba dang / chos thams cad la snang bar mdzad pa'i mnga' bsgyur bas /
translated: The buddhas, the transcendent conquerors, have power over all phenomena and the power to illuminate all phenomena.

original: tshig dang yi ge mtha' yas pa la thogs pa mi mnga' ba'i spobs pa mnga' ba dang / chos thams cad ma lus par yongs su brjod pas mnga' che ba ste /
analyzed: tshig dang yi ge mtha' yas pa la thogs pa mi mnga' ba'i spobs pa mnga' ba dang / chos thams cad ma lus par yongs su brjod pas mnga' che ba ste /
translated: They have the power of unimpeded eloquence with regard to the infinite number of words and letters and the power of great mastery in expressing all phenomena without exception.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi mnga' chen pos mnga' bsgyur ba'i chos dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi mnga' chen pos mnga' bsgyur ba'i chos dang po'o //
translated: This is the first quality that is the great power of the buddhas, the transcendent conquerors.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni sems can ji ltar yongs su smin pa dang / smon lam ji ltar btab pa'i tshul @20a *//
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni sems can ji ltar yongs su smin pa dang / smon lam ji ltar btab pa'i tshul @20a *//
translated: The blessed buddhas are the ones who bring sentient beings to full maturity and who act in accordance with the aspirations they have made.

original: bzhin du 'dul ba la thogs pa mi mnga' bas mnga' che ste /
analyzed: bzhin du 'dul ba la thogs pa mi mnga' bas mnga' che ste /
translated: The Blessed Buddhas are powerful because they are unimpeded in disciplining sentient beings in accordance with their level of maturity and the way they have made aspirations.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas kyi mnga' chen pos mnga' ba sgyur ba'i chos gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas kyi mnga' chen pos mnga' ba sgyur ba'i chos gnyis pa'o //
translated: This is the second attribute of the Buddhas, that of being powerful through the great power of the Buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni 'jig rten gyi khams ma lus pa thams cad sems can gcig la'ang gnod pa med par rnam pa drug tu rab tu bskyod pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams rgyan rnam par bkod pa grangs med tshad med pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni 'jig rten gyi khams ma lus pa thams cad sems can gcig la'ang gnod pa med par rnam pa drug tu rab tu bskyod pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams rgyan rnam par bkod pa grangs med tshad med pa dang ldan pa /
translated: The Blessed Buddhas can shake all the worlds in all the universes in six ways, without harming even a single sentient being, and they can adorn and arrange countless, immeasurable universes with ornaments.

original: nam mkha'i dbyings kyi mthas gtugs pa thams cad gcig nas gcig tu 'phang ba dang / gcig nas gcig tu gzhug pa dang / gcig nas gcig tu bsdu ba dang / gcig nas gcig tu bsre bas 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan dang / gzhan dag gzhan dang gzhan gyi phyogs su rab tu bzhag kyang /
analyzed: nam mkha'i dbyings kyi mthas gtugs pa thams cad gcig nas gcig tu 'phang ba dang / gcig nas gcig tu gzhug pa dang / gcig nas gcig tu bsdu ba dang / gcig nas gcig tu bsre bas 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan dang / gzhan dag gzhan dang gzhan gyi phyogs su rab tu bzhag kyang /
translated: They are able to project all worlds to the ends of space, one after the other, to lead them from one world to another, to gather them from one world to another, and to blend them from one world to another, placing them in other worlds, in other directions.

original: sems can gyi khams rnams 'khor zhing rmongs par mi 'gyur la the tshom du mi 'gyur bar mdzad pas mnga' che ba ste /
analyzed: sems can gyi khams rnams 'khor zhing rmongs par mi 'gyur la the tshom du mi 'gyur bar mdzad pas mnga' che ba ste /
translated: And yet they do this without disturbing the realms of sentient beings, without confusing them, without their having any doubts.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas kyi mnga' chen pos mnga' bsgyur ba'i chos gsum pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas kyi mnga' chen pos mnga' bsgyur ba'i chos gsum pa'o //
translated: This is the third power of the buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni 'jig rten gyi khams ma lus pa thams cad byin gyis rlob pa'i ye shes kyis 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgyan phan tshun du byin gyis brlab pa dang / thugs skad cig gis 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi rgyan yang dag par bstan pa dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni 'jig rten gyi khams ma lus pa thams cad byin gyis rlob pa'i ye shes kyis 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgyan phan tshun du byin gyis brlab pa dang / thugs skad cig gis 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi rgyan yang dag par bstan pa dang /
translated: in displaying the adornments of all worlds in a single instant,

original: bskal pa grangs med par brjod kyang yi ge shin tu bstan pa zad mi shes pa dang / 'jig rten @20b gyi khams ma lus pa thams cad rgyan thams cad kyis rnam par brgyan pa dang / mi mthun pa med cing nye bar nyon mongs pa med pa dang /
analyzed: bskal pa grangs med par brjod kyang yi ge shin tu bstan pa zad mi shes pa dang / 'jig rten @20b gyi khams ma lus pa thams cad rgyan thams cad kyis rnam par brgyan pa dang / mi mthun pa med cing nye bar nyon mongs pa med pa dang /
translated: in the inexhaustible display of the syllables even though they speak for countless eons, in adorning all worlds without exception with all adornments, in the absence of any conflict and in the absence of any defilement,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing gcig tu yongs su 'du bar sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnam par dag pa thams cad byin gyis brlab pa la mnga' che ba ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing gcig tu yongs su 'du bar sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnam par dag pa thams cad byin gyis brlab pa la mnga' che ba ste /
translated: and in blessing all the pure buddhafields to be included in a single buddhafield.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi mnga' chen pos mnga' bsgyur ba'i chos bzhi pa'o; ;sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni sangs rgyas kyis 'dul ba'i sems can gzigs na sems can gcig gi don du bskal pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi mnga' chen pos mnga' bsgyur ba'i chos bzhi pa'o; ;sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni sangs rgyas kyis 'dul ba'i sems can gzigs na sems can gcig gi don du bskal pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod
translated: “The blessed buddhas, when they see beings who are to be guided by the buddhas, remain in a single cross-legged posture for inexpressibly inexpressible eons for the sake of a single being.

original: du med par skyil mo krung gcig gis bzhugs na yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la mi bde ba mi mnga' zhing thugs la mi bde ba mi mnga' ste /
analyzed: du med par skyil mo krung gcig gis bzhugs na yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la mi bde ba mi mnga' zhing thugs la mi bde ba mi mnga' ste /
translated: Even so, the body of the thus-gone ones is not uncomfortable, nor is their mind uncomfortable.🔽They do not forget the being to be guided, and they do not pass beyond the time to guide them.🔽Just as they do for one being, in the same way, in a gradual process, they remain, blessing their lives to last until the end of time, in all the worlds without exception.

original: gang zag de yang mi bsnyel bas 'dul ba'i dus las mi 'da' ba dang / gang zag gcig la ji lta ba de bzhin du rim pa rim pas 'jig rten gyi khams ma lus pa thams cad du phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa'i sku tshe la mnga' bar byin gyis brlabs te bzhugs kyang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la skyo ba mi🔽mnga' ba ste /
analyzed: gang zag de yang mi bsnyel bas 'dul ba'i dus las mi 'da' ba dang / gang zag gcig la ji lta ba de bzhin du rim pa rim pas 'jig rten gyi khams ma lus pa thams cad du phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa'i sku tshe la mnga' bar byin gyis brlabs te bzhugs kyang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la skyo ba mi🔽mnga' ba ste /
translated: Yet the blessed buddhas do not become weary of this.

original: de ltar sems can gyi khams thams cad mthar gyis rim pas /
analyzed: de ltar sems can gyi khams thams cad mthar gyis rim pas /
translated: Thus, in due order, all the realms of sentient beings

original: sangs rgyas kyis 'dul ba'i gang zag gi don du yongs su skyong ba mdzad pa la mnga' che ba ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis 'dul ba'i gang zag gi don du yongs su skyong ba mdzad pa la mnga' che ba ste /
translated: are completely protected for the sake of those individuals who are to be guided by the buddhas.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi mnga' chen pos mnga' bsgyur ba'i chos lnga pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi mnga' chen pos mnga' bsgyur ba'i chos lnga pa'o //
translated: This is the fifth of the great lords of the buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni /
translated: The buddhas, the bhagavans,

original: 'jig rten gyi khams ma lus pa @21a *//
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams ma lus pa @21a *//
translated: in all the worlds without exception

original: thams cad du yang dag par gzhol ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i bzhud pas 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du bzhud pa la thag thogs mi mnga' ba dang / phyogs bcu'i chos kyi dbyings ma lus pa thams cad kyi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgyud rgya mtsho 'byams klas pa dang /
analyzed: thams cad du yang dag par gzhol ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i bzhud pas 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du bzhud pa la thag thogs mi mnga' ba dang / phyogs bcu'i chos kyi dbyings ma lus pa thams cad kyi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgyud rgya mtsho 'byams klas pa dang /
translated: are unhindered in their movement to all worlds through the tathagata’s movement that is completely directed to all worlds.

original: phyogs kyi dra ba'i rgyud thams cad du thugs skad cig gcig dang ldan pas bzhud par byin gyis rlob cing chos kyi dbyings shin tu bstan pa khong du chud par bya bas /
analyzed: phyogs kyi dra ba'i rgyud thams cad du thugs skad cig gcig dang ldan pas bzhud par byin gyis rlob cing chos kyi dbyings shin tu bstan pa khong du chud par bya bas /
translated: He blessed them so that in a single instant they could travel to all the networks of the universes and, by understanding the teaching of the realm of phenomena,🔽

original: chos kyi 'khor lo thogs pa med pa rab tu bskor ba la mnga' che ba ste /
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo thogs pa med pa rab tu bskor ba la mnga' che ba ste /
translated: They are empowered to go to all the networks of the world systems in a single instant of mind and to turn the wheel of the Dharma without impediment, in order to make understood the teaching of the realm of phenomena.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi mnga' chen pos mnga' bsgyur ba'i chos drug pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi mnga' chen pos mnga' bsgyur ba'i chos drug pa'o //
translated: This is the sixth power of the bhagavān buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni 'dul ba'i sems can gyi khams thams cad kyi don du thugs skad cig re re la bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya bar mnga' che ba ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni 'dul ba'i sems can gyi khams thams cad kyi don du thugs skad cig re re la bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya bar mnga' che ba ste /
translated: The bhagavān buddhas are empowered to manifest complete and perfect awakening in a single instant of mind for the sake of all the realms of beings to be trained.

original: de la chos thams cad mngon par sangs rgyas pa gang yang med la /🔽gang gis mngon par sangs rgyas pa'ang med de /
analyzed: de la chos thams cad mngon par sangs rgyas pa gang yang med la / gang gis mngon par sangs rgyas pa'ang med de /
translated: In this, there is no complete and perfect awakening to all phenomena.🔽There is no one who completely and perfectly awakens.

original: mngon par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba med kyang /
analyzed: mngon par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba med kyang /
translated: There is no complete and perfect awakening.

original: slob pa'i sa la gnas shing mngon par 'tshang rgya bar yang mi brjod pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyang bsgribs pa med par rtogs par thugs su chud pas sems can thams cad 'dul ba'i don du ye shes tshad med pa'i tshul gyis /
analyzed: slob pa'i sa la gnas shing mngon par 'tshang rgya bar yang mi brjod pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyang bsgribs pa med par rtogs par thugs su chud pas sems can thams cad 'dul ba'i don du ye shes tshad med pa'i tshul gyis /
translated: They do not say that they abide on the stage of learning and that they are fully enlightened.🔽And they understand that they have realized all the qualities of the Buddha without obstruction.

original: @21b sangs rgyas kyi rnam par 'phrul pa chen po'i yul yongs su rgyun mi gcod pa 'di ni /
analyzed: @21b sangs rgyas kyi rnam par 'phrul pa chen po'i yul yongs su rgyun mi gcod pa 'di ni /
translated: For the sake of guiding all sentient beings, they do not interrupt the domain of the great manifestations of the Buddha by means of immeasurable knowledge.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi mnga' chen pos mnga' bsgyur ba'i chos bdun pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi mnga' chen pos mnga' bsgyur ba'i chos bdun pa'o //
translated: This is the seventh quality of the Lord Buddhas, which they have mastered by the great power of the Buddha.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni spyan gyi skye mched kyis sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las gang bsgrub pa de snyan gyi skye mched kyis yongs su grub par mdzad do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni spyan gyi skye mched kyis sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las gang bsgrub pa de snyan gyi skye mched kyis yongs su grub par mdzad do //
translated: The Lord Buddhas accomplish the deeds of the Buddha by means of the eye faculty, and they perfect them by means of the ear faculty.

original: snyan gyi skye mched kyis sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las gang bsgrub pa de shangs kyi skye mched kyis yongs su grub par mdzad do //🔽shangs kyi skye mched kyis sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las gang bsgrub pa de ljags kyi skye mched kyis yongs su grub par mdzad do //🔽ljags kyi skye mched kyis sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las gang bsgrub pa de ni sku'i skye mched kyis yongs su grub par mdzad do //
analyzed: snyan gyi skye mched kyis sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las gang bsgrub pa de shangs kyi skye mched kyis yongs su grub par mdzad do // shangs kyi skye mched kyis sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las gang bsgrub pa de ljags kyi skye mched kyis yongs su grub par mdzad do // ljags kyi skye mched kyis sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las gang bsgrub pa de ni sku'i skye mched kyis yongs su grub par mdzad do //
translated: Whatever Buddha activity is accomplished by the ear sense-sphere, that is fully accomplished by the nose sense-sphere.🔽Whatever Buddha activity is accomplished by the nose sense-sphere, that is fully accomplished by the tongue sense-sphere.🔽Whatever Buddha activity is accomplished by the tongue sense-sphere, that is fully accomplished by the body sense-sphere.

original: sku'i skye mched kyis sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las gang bsgrub pa de thugs kyi skye mched kyis yongs su grub par mdzad do //
analyzed: sku'i skye mched kyis sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las gang bsgrub pa de thugs kyi skye mched kyis yongs su grub par mdzad do //
translated: Whatever Buddha activity is accomplished by the body sense-sphere, that is fully accomplished by the mind sense-sphere.

original: thugs kyi skye mched kyis sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las gang bsgrub pa de 'jig rten gyi khams ma lus pa thams cad kyi dmigs pa 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa sna tshogs rnam par phye ba thams cad du grub par mdzad do //
analyzed: thugs kyi skye mched kyis sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las gang bsgrub pa de 'jig rten gyi khams ma lus pa thams cad kyi dmigs pa 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa sna tshogs rnam par phye ba thams cad du grub par mdzad do //
translated: Whatever buddha activity is accomplished by the eye faculty of the mind is accomplished in all the various worlds of the world systems, both mundane and supramundane.

original: de bzhin du dmigs pa thams cad re re yang snrel zhing bsgrub pas; sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las bsgrub pa la mnga' che ba ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du dmigs pa thams cad re re yang snrel zhing bsgrub pas; sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las bsgrub pa la mnga' che ba ste /
translated: In the same way, each and every object is accomplished by the mind faculty of the eye, and so on, and thus the buddha activity is accomplished with great power.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi mnga' chen pos mnga' bsgyur ba'i chos brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi mnga' chen pos mnga' bsgyur ba'i chos brgyad pa'o //
translated: This is the eighth power of the blessed buddhas.

original: sangs @22a *// rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni rang gi sku'i ba spu'i bu ga gcig gi nang du sems can gyi khams ma lus pa thams cad gzud par mdzad cing khongs su chud bar mdzad pa dang / sems can re re zhing yang lus sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa tsam du yangs par mdzad kyang /
analyzed: sangs @22a *// rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni rang gi sku'i ba spu'i bu ga gcig gi nang du sems can gyi khams ma lus pa thams cad gzud par mdzad cing khongs su chud bar mdzad pa dang / sems can re re zhing yang lus sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa tsam du yangs par mdzad kyang /
translated: The blessed buddhas can cause all the realms of sentient beings to enter and be included within a single pore of their bodies.🔽And they can make the bodies of each and every sentient being as vast as inexpressibly many buddhafields,🔽without causing any harm or discomfort to those sentient beings. And they can cause each and every sentient being to remain for inexpressibly many eons, passing from one world system to another,

original: sems can de dag la gnod pa dang / mi bde bar mi 'gyur ba dang; de dag du yang sems can re re zhing 'jig rten gyi khams gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pas bskal pa grangs med pa zad par gnas par bya ba dang / 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med par gom pa gcig gis phyin pas 'jig rten gyi khams de dag tu sangs rgyas byung ba rnams kyi spyan sngar 'gro bar bya ba dang /
analyzed: sems can de dag la gnod pa dang / mi bde bar mi 'gyur ba dang; de dag du yang sems can re re zhing 'jig rten gyi khams gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pas bskal pa grangs med pa zad par gnas par bya ba dang / 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med par gom pa gcig gis phyin pas 'jig rten gyi khams de dag tu sangs rgyas byung ba rnams kyi spyan sngar 'gro bar bya ba dang /
translated: and to go in a single step to inexpressibly many world systems, to go into the presence of the buddhas who have appeared in those world systems,

original: sangs rgyas de dag byung ba'i tshe yang brjod du med pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgyud dang gling de dag na sems can gyi gtso bos brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar bya ba dang / ba spu'i bu ga de nas sangs rgyas gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa 'byung bar bya ba dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas de dag byung ba'i tshe yang brjod du med pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgyud dang gling de dag na sems can gyi gtso bos brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar bya ba dang / ba spu'i bu ga de nas sangs rgyas gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa 'byung bar bya ba dang /
translated: When those buddhas appear, they turn the Dharma wheel of inexpressibly inexpressible Dharma for the foremost beings in those world systems and continents of inexpressible universes.🔽From each of those pores they cause the lineage of buddhas to appear, which is inexpressibly inexpressible.

original: sems can gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa 'byung bar bya ba dang / chos kyi 'khor lo gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa bskor bar bya ba dang / chos kyi dbyings bstan pa gcig nas @22b gcig tu brgyud pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa shin tu bstan par bya ba dang /
analyzed: sems can gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa 'byung bar bya ba dang / chos kyi 'khor lo gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa bskor bar bya ba dang / chos kyi dbyings bstan pa gcig nas @22b gcig tu brgyud pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa shin tu bstan par bya ba dang /
translated: They cause the lineage of beings to appear, which is inexpressibly inexpressible. They turn the wheel of Dharma, which is inexpressibly inexpressible. They teach the realm of phenomena, which is inexpressibly inexpressible.

original: 'das pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa brjod du med pa dang / ma 'ongs pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa brjod du med pa dang / da ltar byung ba gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa brjod du med pa yongs su brjod par bya ba dang /
analyzed: 'das pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa brjod du med pa dang / ma 'ongs pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa brjod du med pa dang / da ltar byung ba gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa brjod du med pa yongs su brjod par bya ba dang /
translated: It is to describe the past, which is an unbroken continuum of inexpressibly inexpressible eons, the future, which is an unbroken continuum of inexpressibly inexpressible eons, and the present, which is an unbroken continuum of inexpressibly inexpressible eons.

original: nam mkha'i dbyings mtha' dang dbus med par bstan pa kun tu mtshams med par sems can thams cad 'ong zhing 'gro ba dang / skye ba'i skye mched thams cad du 'dod pa'i longs spyod rgya chen po bgegs med pa thams cad 'byung bar bya ba la mnga' che ba ste /
analyzed: nam mkha'i dbyings mtha' dang dbus med par bstan pa kun tu mtshams med par sems can thams cad 'ong zhing 'gro ba dang / skye ba'i skye mched thams cad du 'dod pa'i longs spyod rgya chen po bgegs med pa thams cad 'byung bar bya ba la mnga' che ba ste /
translated: It is to have great power over the arising of all the enjoyments of the world without obstruction in all the realms of sentient beings, who are limitless and infinite like space, and who come and go.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi mnga' chen pos mnga' sgyur ba'i chos dgu pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi mnga' chen pos mnga' sgyur ba'i chos dgu pa'o //
translated: This is the ninth great power of the blessed buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni chos kyi dbyings ma lus pa thams cad du padmo'i rgyan chen pos brgyan pa'i sengge'i khri padmo'i snying po can la de bzhin gshegs pa gcig gi chos kyi dbyings tshad med pa thams cad du khyab pa'i skus byang chub tu mngon
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni chos kyi dbyings ma lus pa thams cad du padmo'i rgyan chen pos brgyan pa'i sengge'i khri padmo'i snying po can la de bzhin gshegs pa gcig gi chos kyi dbyings tshad med pa thams cad du khyab pa'i skus byang chub tu mngon

original: par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te sangs rgyas kyi rnam par 'phrul pa thams cad yongs su bstan pa mdzad pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa gcig gi ji lta bar 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi sems can gyi gtso bo thams cad kyang de bzhin du dgongs pa skad cig ma re re'i byin gyis rlabs kyis brlabs pa dang /
analyzed: par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te sangs rgyas kyi rnam par 'phrul pa thams cad yongs su bstan pa mdzad pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa gcig gi ji lta bar 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi sems can gyi gtso bo thams cad kyang de bzhin du dgongs pa skad cig ma re re'i byin gyis rlabs kyis brlabs pa dang /

translated: The Blessed Buddhas become enlightened to Awakening in order to perfect the major and minor marks and the visible body.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya'o //

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang mnyam pa nyid yongs su rdzogs pas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya ste /
translated: The blessed buddhas awaken to perfect buddhahood by perfecting the state of equality with all tathāgatas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las thams cad yongs su rdzogs par mdzad nas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las thams cad yongs su rdzogs par mdzad nas /
translated: Having perfected all the activities of a buddha,

analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'da'o //
translated: they pass into parinirvāṇa.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: “O son of the victors,

analyzed: bcu po de dag ni /
translated: these ten

analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su rdzogs pa tshad med pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o //
translated: are the immeasurable and inconceivable perfect qualities of the blessed buddhas.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: “O son of the victors,

original: bcu po 'di dag ni /
analyzed: bcu po 'di dag ni /
translated: these ten

analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi thabs mkhas pa ste /
translated: are the skillful means of the blessed buddhas.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten?

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni chos thams cad byin gyis brlabs pa med cing spros pa thams cad med par yang thugs su chud la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni chos thams cad byin gyis brlabs pa med cing spros pa thams cad med par yang thugs su chud la /
translated: The Lord Buddhas have realized that all phenomena are without blessing and without conceptual elaboration.

original: dge ba'i sgo nas sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyang shin tu ston cing brjod de /
analyzed: dge ba'i sgo nas sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyang shin tu ston cing brjod de /

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi thabs mkhas pa dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi thabs mkhas pa dang po'o //
translated: This is the first skillful means of the Lord Buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni chos thams cad la gzigs pa med cing phan tshun du mkhyen pa med do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni chos thams cad la gzigs pa med cing phan tshun du mkhyen pa med do //
translated: The Lord Buddhas have realized that all phenomena are without vision and without mutual knowledge.

original: ma bcings ma gol ba dang / gzung ba med cing bsags pa med de /
analyzed: ma bcings ma gol ba dang / gzung ba med cing bsags pa med de /
translated: They are not bound, not fallen, not grasped, not accumulated,

original: yongs su rdzogs pa med par yang thugs su chud la sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la mnga' dam pa yang brnyes te /
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs pa med par yang thugs su chud la sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la mnga' dam pa yang brnyes te /
translated: and not fully completed. They have also attained the highest mastery over all the qualities of the Buddhas.

original: @24b sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams chos thams cad la mnga' bsgyur ba de yang yang dag pa de kho na nyid ma nor ba rnam pa gzhan du mi 'gyur ba dang / chos thams cad bdag gi med cing yongs su 'dzin pa med la de kho na nyid kyi mtha' las rnam par mi 'da' yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mnga' chen pos chos kyi dbyings thams cad snang ba la'ang rab tu mkhyen pa 'di ni /
analyzed: @24b sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams chos thams cad la mnga' bsgyur ba de yang yang dag pa de kho na nyid ma nor ba rnam pa gzhan du mi 'gyur ba dang / chos thams cad bdag gi med cing yongs su 'dzin pa med la de kho na nyid kyi mtha' las rnam par mi 'da' yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mnga' chen pos chos kyi dbyings thams cad snang ba la'ang rab tu mkhyen pa 'di ni /
translated: Although all phenomena are devoid of self and are ungraspable and do not transcend the limit of suchness, the blessed buddhas, through their great mastery, know the entire realm of phenomena to be illuminated.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi thabs mkhas pa gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi thabs mkhas pa gnyis pa'o //
translated: This is the second skillful means of the blessed buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mtshan ma'i mtha' thams cad mi mnga' ste /🔽mtshan ma thams cad dang mi 'grogs shing /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mtshan ma'i mtha' thams cad mi mnga' ste / mtshan ma thams cad dang mi 'grogs shing /
translated: The blessed buddhas are not endowed with any extreme of characteristics.🔽They are not associated with any characteristics.

original: mtshan ma'i mngon par shes pa thams cad dang ma 'dres la /
analyzed: mtshan ma'i mngon par shes pa thams cad dang ma 'dres la /
translated: They are not mixed with any of the superknowledges of characteristics.

original: de'i rang bzhin du ngo bo nyid med pa dang / ji ltar ngo bo nyid med pa'i sgra'i tshul thams cad thugs su chud kyang gzugs kyi mtshan ma'i sku gzugs rnam par dag pa grangs med pa dang / zhing gi mtshan ma dang / rnam par spyod pa'i mtshan ma zad mi shes pa rnam pa sna tshogs yang dag par bstan cing bshad pa'i ye shes kyi phung po mun pa med pa 'gro ba thams cad kyi sgron ma chen por gyur pas mun pa med pa'i snang ba ston pa 'di ni
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin du ngo bo nyid med pa dang / ji ltar ngo bo nyid med pa'i sgra'i tshul thams cad thugs su chud kyang gzugs kyi mtshan ma'i sku gzugs rnam par dag pa grangs med pa dang / zhing gi mtshan ma dang / rnam par spyod pa'i mtshan ma zad mi shes pa rnam pa sna tshogs yang dag par bstan cing bshad pa'i ye shes kyi phung po mun pa med pa 'gro ba thams cad kyi sgron ma chen por gyur pas mun pa med pa'i snang ba ston pa 'di ni
translated: The buddhas, the bhagavats, have the wisdom aggregate that is free from darkness, which is the teaching and explanation of the various kinds of pure forms of the body of signs of form, the signs of the realm, and the signs of conduct, which are beyond measure, and which are the great lamp for all beings, through the manifestation of the light that is free from darkness, which is the nature that lacks entityness and the way in which it lacks entityness, even though they have comprehended all the ways of words.

original: / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi thabs mkhas pa gsum pa'o //
analyzed: / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi thabs mkhas pa gsum pa'o //
translated: This is the third skillful method of the buddha bhagavats.

original: chags pa med pa'i mtha' ni sngon gyi mtha' yang ma yin /
analyzed: chags pa med pa'i mtha' ni sngon gyi mtha' yang ma yin /
translated: The end of nonattachment is not the prior end,

original: phyi ma'i mtha' yang ma yin /
analyzed: phyi ma'i mtha' yang ma yin /
translated: it is not the later end,

original: da ltar byung ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba yang ma yin te /
translated: and it is not the present.

original: @25a *// chos kyi dbyings su gnas pa ni 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba yang ma yin pas /
analyzed: @25a *// chos kyi dbyings su gnas pa ni 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba yang ma yin pas /
translated: The realm of phenomena is not past, future, or present.

original: de bzhin nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyis 'byung ba med kyang sangs rgyas 'byung ba rnams kyi rigs tshad med pa'i phyir shin tu bstan pa brjod du med pas 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas pa skye ba yang rab tu brjod cing kun tu gzigs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi yul gyis de bzhin du gzigs pa 'di ni /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyis 'byung ba med kyang sangs rgyas 'byung ba rnams kyi rigs tshad med pa'i phyir shin tu bstan pa brjod du med pas 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas pa skye ba yang rab tu brjod cing kun tu gzigs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi yul gyis de bzhin du gzigs pa 'di ni /
translated: Although it does not arise through the characteristic of suchness, the arising of the buddhas is taught through the inexpressible teaching of the immeasurable lineage. Thus, the arising of the buddhas of the past, future, and present is fully described. This is the vision of the buddhas, who see in this way through the domain of the buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi thabs mkhas pa bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi thabs mkhas pa bzhi pa'o //
translated: This is the fourth skillful means of the blessed buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni sku'i 'phrin las dang / gsung gi 'phrin las dang / thugs kyi 'phrin las kyi mngon par 'du mdzad pa yang mi mnga' la yongs su blang ba mi mnga' bas bzhugs shing rnam par phye ba med pa'i mthar thug pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni sku'i 'phrin las dang / gsung gi 'phrin las dang / thugs kyi 'phrin las kyi mngon par 'du mdzad pa yang mi mnga' la yongs su blang ba mi mnga' bas bzhugs shing rnam par phye ba med pa'i mthar thug pa ste /
translated: The blessed buddhas do not engage in physical, verbal, or mental activity, and they do not adopt or reject anything. They abide in the ultimate state of non-differentiation.

original: dor ba med pa'i chos kyi gnas kyi pha rol tu phyin la bgrang ba'i tshul las rnam par 'das kyang tshul grangs med pa'i mdzod du gyur cing; bgrang ba dang mngon par sgrub pa mtha' yas pa dang / 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa rnam pa sna tshogs tha dad pa'i grangs kyi tshul thugs su chud pa ye shes bsgrigs pa med pas gzigs pa rnams te /
analyzed: dor ba med pa'i chos kyi gnas kyi pha rol tu phyin la bgrang ba'i tshul las rnam par 'das kyang tshul grangs med pa'i mdzod du gyur cing; bgrang ba dang mngon par sgrub pa mtha' yas pa dang / 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa rnam pa sna tshogs tha dad pa'i grangs kyi tshul thugs su chud pa ye shes bsgrigs pa med pas gzigs pa rnams te /
translated: They have reached the perfection of the state of non-discarding, and they transcend all forms of enumeration. They are treasuries of countless ways of enumerating things, and they have infinite ways of counting and accomplishing things. They have unobscured vision, and they understand the various ways of enumerating things, whether mundane or supramundane.

original: chos kyi dbyings ma lus pa thams cad kyi sems can gdul ba rnam par dmigs pa la rdzu 'phrul sna tshogs tshad med mu med par mngon @25b par sgrub pa mdzad pa 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi thabs mkhas pa lnga pa'o
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings ma lus pa thams cad kyi sems can gdul ba rnam par dmigs pa la rdzu 'phrul sna tshogs tshad med mu med par mngon @25b par sgrub pa mdzad pa 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi thabs mkhas pa lnga pa'o
translated: The buddhas, the bhagavats, manifest infinite and limitless kinds of miracles in order to guide beings in all the realms of phenomena. This is the fifth skillful means of the buddhas, the bhagavats.

original: // chos thams cad lta ba med pas tha mi dad pa dang / bye brag med pa dang / 'byung ba med pa dang / mtshan nyid med pa dang / sna tshogs med pa dang / blang ba med pa dang / dor ba med pa dang /
analyzed: // chos thams cad lta ba med pas tha mi dad pa dang / bye brag med pa dang / 'byung ba med pa dang / mtshan nyid med pa dang / sna tshogs med pa dang / blang ba med pa dang / dor ba med pa dang /
translated: “All phenomena are undifferentiated, without distinctions, without origination, without characteristics, without variety, without acceptance, without rejection,

original: rang bzhin med par rab tu mkhyen kyang chos kyi rgyud shin tu nges par yang dag par sgrub cing 'jig rten gyi tshul dang 'gal ba med pa dang / rang bzhin med pa yang yang dag par gzigs pas thams cad mkhyen pa /
analyzed: rang bzhin med par rab tu mkhyen kyang chos kyi rgyud shin tu nges par yang dag par sgrub cing 'jig rten gyi tshul dang 'gal ba med pa dang / rang bzhin med pa yang yang dag par gzigs pas thams cad mkhyen pa /
translated: and without nature. Although they are fully known in this way, the buddhas, the bhagavats, establish the continuity of phenomena in a very precise way without contradicting worldly conventions.

original: thams cad gzigs pa /
analyzed: thams cad gzigs pa /
translated: They see that phenomena are without nature and are omniscient and all-seeing.

original: mkhyen par bya ba thams cad ma lus par gzigs pas chos la mnga' bsgyur ba thams cad kyang rab tu ston la /
analyzed: mkhyen par bya ba thams cad ma lus par gzigs pas chos la mnga' bsgyur ba thams cad kyang rab tu ston la /
translated: They also reveal all the powers over phenomena that come from seeing all knowable objects without exception.

original: de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin las kyang mi nyams pa 'di ni /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin las kyang mi nyams pa 'di ni /
translated: And they do not fall from the nature of suchness.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi thabs mkhas pa drug pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi thabs mkhas pa drug pa'o //
translated: This is the sixth skillful means of the blessed buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni thugs su chud pa'i rnam pa gcig gis gzhan dang gzhan mkhyen par bya ba /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni thugs su chud pa'i rnam pa gcig gis gzhan dang gzhan mkhyen par bya ba /
translated: “The blessed buddhas know with a single realization all the phenomena that are to be known in other and other ways.

original: chos de'i skyon med pa las rnam par ma 'das pa gnas pa med pa /
analyzed: chos de'i skyon med pa las rnam par ma 'das pa gnas pa med pa /
translated: They know that they do not transcend the flawlessness of those phenomena.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam par dag pa mnyam pa nyid kyi chos skyon med pas dus thams cad du gnas pa rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam par dag pa mnyam pa nyid kyi chos skyon med pas dus thams cad du gnas pa rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: They know that they are not abiding, that they are the flawlessness of the phenomena of the sameness of the pure roots of virtue, and that they are present at all times.

original: de la yang nyi ma gcig gam /
analyzed: de la yang nyi ma gcig gam /
translated: They know that they are not present for one day,

original: zla ba phyed dam /
analyzed: zla ba phyed dam /
translated: for half a month,

original: lo gcig gam /
analyzed: lo gcig gam /
translated: for one year,🔽or for one hundred years.

original: lo brgya'am / bskal pa 'jig pa dang / 'du bas rjes su bsnyag pa dang / phyir phyogs pa mi mnga' bar dus tshad med pa dang / nyi ma gcig dang / yud tsam gcig gi dus dang / snga @26a *//
analyzed: lo brgya'am / bskal pa 'jig pa dang / 'du bas rjes su bsnyag pa dang / phyir phyogs pa mi mnga' bar dus tshad med pa dang / nyi ma gcig dang / yud tsam gcig gi dus dang / snga @26a *//
translated: for one day,🔽for one moment,🔽for the time from morning to noon,🔽for the time from noon to evening,🔽for the time from evening to morning,🔽for the time from morning to evening,🔽for the time of the full measure of the sun,🔽for the time of seven suns,🔽for the time of half a month,

original: dro nas nyi ma phyed kyi dus dang / phyi dro nas snga dro'i dus dang / nyi ma gung nas phyi dro'i dus dang / nyi ma 'grangs pa'i dus dang / nyi ma bdun dang / zla ba phyed kyi dus dang; zla ba dang / lo dang /
analyzed: dro nas nyi ma phyed kyi dus dang / phyi dro nas snga dro'i dus dang / nyi ma gung nas phyi dro'i dus dang / nyi ma 'grangs pa'i dus dang / nyi ma bdun dang / zla ba phyed kyi dus dang; zla ba dang / lo dang /
translated: for the time of a month, for the time of a year,🔽for the time of a hundred years,🔽for the time of one eon,

original: lo brgya'i dus dang / bskal pa gcig gi dus dang / tshad med grangs med pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dus nas /
analyzed: lo brgya'i dus dang / bskal pa gcig gi dus dang / tshad med grangs med pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dus nas /
translated: for the time of an inconceivable, immeasurable, incalculable number,🔽and for the time of the end of the future.

original: phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa'i dus su chos bstan pa dang / chos kyi 'khor lo thogs pa med cing phyir mi ldog /
analyzed: phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa'i dus su chos bstan pa dang / chos kyi 'khor lo thogs pa med cing phyir mi ldog /
translated: The wheel of the Dharma is unimpeded and irreversible.

original: rgyun chad par mi 'gyur /🔽bral bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: rgyun chad par mi 'gyur / bral bar mi 'gyur /
translated: It is not interrupted.🔽It is not separated.

original: bar chad par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: bar chad par mi 'gyur /
translated: It is not obstructed.

original: med par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: med par mi 'gyur /
translated: It is not nonexistent.

original: 'jig par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: 'jig par mi 'gyur /
translated: they do not perish;

original: g-yo bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: g-yo bar mi 'gyur /
translated: they do not move;

original: ring du mi 'gyur /
analyzed: ring du mi 'gyur /
translated: they do not go far;

original: 'khor de na gnas pa nyid du yang rgyun chad par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'khor de na gnas pa nyid du yang rgyun chad par mi 'gyur te /
translated: they do not cease to be present in that assembly.🔽This is the seventh skillful means of the lord buddhas.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi thabs mkhas pa bdun pa'o; ;sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni chos kyi dbyings ma lus pa thams cad du rtag tu dus la bab par bzhugs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi thabs mkhas pa bdun pa'o; ;sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni chos kyi dbyings ma lus pa thams cad du rtag tu dus la bab par bzhugs pa ste /
translated: “The lord buddhas are always present at the right time in all the realms of phenomena without exception.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mi 'jigs pa tshad med pa mnga' ba'o //🔽tha dad pa yang dag par mkhyen pa grangs med pa mnga' ba'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mi 'jigs pa tshad med pa mnga' ba'o // tha dad pa yang dag par mkhyen pa grangs med pa mnga' ba'o //
translated: The lord buddhas have immeasurable fearlessness.🔽They have innumerable perfect knowledges of distinctions.

original: tha dad pa yang dag par mkhyen pa tshad med pa mnga' ba'o //🔽tha dad pa yang dag par mkhyen pa zad mi shes pa mnga' ba'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa yang dag par mkhyen pa tshad med pa mnga' ba'o // tha dad pa yang dag par mkhyen pa zad mi shes pa mnga' ba'o //
translated: They have immeasurable perfect knowledges of distinctions.🔽They have inexhaustible perfect knowledges of distinctions.

original: tha dad pa yang dag par mkhyen pa thogs pa med pa mnga' ba'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa yang dag par mkhyen pa thogs pa med pa mnga' ba'o //
translated: They have unobstructed perfect knowledges of distinctions.

original: tha dad pa yang dag par mkhyen pa mtha' yas pa mnga' ba'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa yang dag par mkhyen pa mtha' yas pa mnga' ba'o //
translated: They have infinite perfect knowledges of distinctions.

original: thun mong ma yin pa'i @26b tha dad pa yang dag par mkhyen pa mnga' ba'o //🔽tha dad pa yang dag par mkhyen pa mthar thug pa med pa mnga' ba'o //🔽tha dad pa yang dag par mkhyen pa de kho na dang ldan pa mnga' ba'o //
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa'i @26b tha dad pa yang dag par mkhyen pa mnga' ba'o // tha dad pa yang dag par mkhyen pa mthar thug pa med pa mnga' ba'o // tha dad pa yang dag par mkhyen pa de kho na dang ldan pa mnga' ba'o //
translated: He has the knowledge of the distinctness of all things.🔽He has the knowledge of the distinctness of all things without exception.🔽He has the knowledge of the distinctness of all things as they are.🔽He has the knowledge of the distinctness of all things in all their modes of expression.

original: tha dad pa yang dag par mkhyen pa tshig gi tshul thams cad rab tu rtogs pa mnga' ba'o //🔽chos thams cad tha dad pa yang dag par mkhyen pa mnga' ba'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa yang dag par mkhyen pa tshig gi tshul thams cad rab tu rtogs pa mnga' ba'o // chos thams cad tha dad pa yang dag par mkhyen pa mnga' ba'o //
translated: He has the knowledge of the distinctness of all things in all their aspects.🔽He teaches the Dharma in all its modes and categories without interruption, in accordance with the aspirations, beliefs, and faculties of all living beings.🔽He teaches the Dharma in all its modes and categories without interruption, in accordance with the aspirations, beliefs, and faculties of all living beings.🔽He teaches the Dharma in all its modes and categories without interruption, in accordance with the aspirations, beliefs, and faculties of all living beings.

analyzed: dang; ming 'gag pa ma yin pa dang / ming med pa ma yin pa dang / ming yod pa ma yin pa dang / ming gcig pa ma yin pa dang / ming tha dad pa ma yin pa dang; ming thams cad ma yin pa dang /
translated: They are not the cessation of names, not the absence of names, not the presence of names, not the same as names, not different from names, and not all names.

original: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis brjod du med pa dang / phyogs med pa dang / brda med pa dang / tshig gi lam med pa dang / sgra dang bral ba; sgra'i rnam pa thams cad mi 'byung ba yongs su bsgrubs pa med pa /

translated: They have realized that all phenomena are naturally inexpressible, without direction, without symbols, without verbal expressions, free from sound, and without the occurrence of any kind of sound.

original: byas pa dang rnam par byas pa med pa /🔽rnam pa gcig ma yin pa /
analyzed: byas pa dang rnam par byas pa med pa / rnam pa gcig ma yin pa /
translated: They are without action and without activity.🔽They are not of one kind and not of many kinds.

original: rnam pa mang po ma yin pa yang thugs su chud la brjod pa dang / spyod pa thams cad la yang pha rol tu phyin pa'i mchog brnyes pa dag ste /
analyzed: rnam pa mang po ma yin pa yang thugs su chud la brjod pa dang / spyod pa thams cad la yang pha rol tu phyin pa'i mchog brnyes pa dag ste /
translated: They have attained the supreme perfection in all their expressions and conduct.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i yul mi mnga' ba dag go /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i yul mi mnga' ba dag go /
translated: They are without the domain of conceptual thoughts.

original: mngon par 'du mdzad pa med pa la rab tu brtson pa dag go /
analyzed: mngon par 'du mdzad pa med pa la rab tu brtson pa dag go /
translated: They are dedicated to the absence of deliberate effort.

original: rtog pa dang / kun tu rtog pa dang / yongs su rtog pa 'gag pa dag go /
analyzed: rtog pa dang / kun tu rtog pa dang / yongs su rtog pa 'gag pa dag go /
translated: the cessation of thoughts, discursive thoughts, and conceptual thoughts,

original: spyod pa thams cad la mi gnas par spyod pa dag ste /
analyzed: spyod pa thams cad la mi gnas par spyod pa dag ste /
translated: and the practice of not dwelling in any practice.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi thabs mkhas pa dgu pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi thabs mkhas pa dgu pa'o //
translated: This is the ninth skillful means of the buddhas, the blessed ones.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni chos thams cad kyi gzugs ma skyes pa rab tu mkhyen pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni chos thams cad kyi gzugs ma skyes pa rab tu mkhyen pa ste /
translated: “The buddhas, the blessed ones, know the non-arising of the form of all phenomena.

original: tshor ba'i spros pa med pa dang / 'du shes kyi grangs med pa dang / 'du byed kun tu rgyu ba med pa dang / rnam par shes pa nye bar len pa med pa dang / rang bzhin gyis zhi bar rab tu @27b mkhyen te /
analyzed: tshor ba'i spros pa med pa dang / 'du shes kyi grangs med pa dang / 'du byed kun tu rgyu ba med pa dang / rnam par shes pa nye bar len pa med pa dang / rang bzhin gyis zhi bar rab tu @27b mkhyen te /
translated: They know the absence of proliferation of feelings, the non-enumeration of perceptions, the non-wandering of volitions, the non-appropriation of consciousness, and the natural peace of all phenomena.

original: chos thams cad skye mched kyi rgyud med pa dang / khams rnams mi dmigs pa dang / chos thams cad mi 'jigs pa dang / chos thams cad bskyod du med cing rang bzhin gyis nam mkha' lta bu dang / chos thams cad dben pa dang /🔽las med pa dang / rnam par smin pa med pa dang / spyod pas 'byung ba med pa dang / ma grub pa dang / ma byung ba dang / grangs kyis mi brjod pa dang / yod pa ma yin pa dang / med pa ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: chos thams cad skye mched kyi rgyud med pa dang / khams rnams mi dmigs pa dang / chos thams cad mi 'jigs pa dang / chos thams cad bskyod du med cing rang bzhin gyis nam mkha' lta bu dang / chos thams cad dben pa dang / las med pa dang / rnam par smin pa med pa dang / spyod pas 'byung ba med pa dang / ma grub pa dang / ma byung ba dang / grangs kyis mi brjod pa dang / yod pa ma yin pa dang / med pa ma yin pa dang /
translated: all phenomena are without the continuum of the sense sources, the elements are unobservable, all phenomena are fearless, all phenomena are unmoving and naturally like space, all phenomena are void,🔽without action, without ripening, without arising from conduct, unaccomplished, unarisen, not to be expressed in numbers, not existent, not nonexistent,

original: ma skyes pa dang / ma 'gags pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa dang / skyon med pa dang; gnas med pa dang / yongs su gnas pa med pa dang / yongs su smin par byas pa med pa dang /
analyzed: ma skyes pa dang / ma 'gags pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa dang / skyon med pa dang; gnas med pa dang / yongs su gnas pa med pa dang / yongs su smin par byas pa med pa dang /
translated: not arisen, not ceased, not afflicted, not purified, faultless, baseless, not fully present, not fully ripened,

original: rnam par btul ba med pa dang / sems can med pa dang / sems can med pa ma yin pa dang / srog med pa dang / srog med pa ma yin pa dang / rkyen med pa dang / rkyen med pa ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: rnam par btul ba med pa dang / sems can med pa dang / sems can med pa ma yin pa dang / srog med pa dang / srog med pa ma yin pa dang / rkyen med pa dang / rkyen med pa ma yin pa dang /
translated: They have realized that all phenomena are neither tamed nor untamed, neither sentient nor not sentient, neither living nor not living, neither conditioned nor unconditioned,

original: rten pa med pa dang / rten pa med pa ma yin par chos thams cad thugs su chud kyang chos kyi dbyings thams cad shin tu bstan pa la pha rol tu phyin pa'i dam pa brnyes pa dag ste /
analyzed: rten pa med pa dang / rten pa med pa ma yin par chos thams cad thugs su chud kyang chos kyi dbyings thams cad shin tu bstan pa la pha rol tu phyin pa'i dam pa brnyes pa dag ste /
translated: and neither dependent nor independent. They have attained the highest perfection in the teachings of the realm of phenomena.

original: nges pa dang / ma nges pa dang / log par nges pa'i phung po gsum rnam par dgod pa rnams la stobs bcus thugs su chud pa'i ye shes mi 'jigs pa bzhis rnam par dag pa'i sangs rgyas kyi yul chen po dang ldan pas seng ge'i sgra sgrog pa 'di ni /🔽sangs rgyas @28a *//
analyzed: nges pa dang / ma nges pa dang / log par nges pa'i phung po gsum rnam par dgod pa rnams la stobs bcus thugs su chud pa'i ye shes mi 'jigs pa bzhis rnam par dag pa'i sangs rgyas kyi yul chen po dang ldan pas seng ge'i sgra sgrog pa 'di ni / sangs rgyas @28a *//
translated: They have the great domain of the buddhas, which is purified by the fourfold fearlessness and the wisdom of realization by means of the ten powers. They proclaim the lion’s roar in order to establish the three groups of beings in certainty, uncertainty, and wrongness.🔽This is the tenth skillful means of the buddhas,

original: bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi thabs mkhas pa bcu pa ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi thabs mkhas pa bcu pa ste /
translated: bhagavāns.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras /

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: O son of the victors!

original: bcu po 'di dag ni /
analyzed: bcu po 'di dag ni /
translated: These are the ten
