analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las rgya chen po tshad med pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa rnams te /
translated: vast, immeasurable, inconceivable activities of the blessed buddhas.

original: de dag ni sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs ma gtogs par lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten dang / 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis 'jug par mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ni sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs ma gtogs par lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten dang / 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis 'jug par mi nus pa'o //
translated: Except for those blessed by the Buddha, they cannot be comprehended by the world with its gods, humans, and asuras, or by the hearers and solitary buddhas of the past, future, or present.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten?

original: phyogs bcu'i nam mkha'i dbyings kyi mthas gtugs pa'i chos kyi dbyings thams cad kyi 'jig rten gyi khams ma lus pa thams cad du dga' ldan du skye ba bstan pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa mu med pa dag la sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las mdzad de /
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i nam mkha'i dbyings kyi mthas gtugs pa'i chos kyi dbyings thams cad kyi 'jig rten gyi khams ma lus pa thams cad du dga' ldan du skye ba bstan pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa mu med pa dag la sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las mdzad de /
translated: In all the world systems of the ten directions, throughout the entire realm of phenomena, they demonstrated taking birth in the Tuṣita realm and engaged in the enlightened activity of the buddhas while engaging in the infinite conduct of bodhisattvas.

original: kha dog tshad med pa /🔽gzi brjid tshad med pa /
analyzed: kha dog tshad med pa / gzi brjid tshad med pa /
translated: They had immeasurable colors,🔽immeasurable splendor,

original: snang ba tshad med pa /
analyzed: snang ba tshad med pa /
translated: immeasurable radiance,

original: dbyangs tshad med pa /
analyzed: dbyangs tshad med pa /
translated: immeasurable voices,

original: dbyangs kyi yan lag rnam par dag pa tshad med pa /
analyzed: dbyangs kyi yan lag rnam par dag pa tshad med pa /
translated: immeasurable pure aspects of speech,

original: gsung brjod pas rnam par dmigs pa tshad med pa /
analyzed: gsung brjod pas rnam par dmigs pa tshad med pa /
translated: immeasurable expressions of speech,

original: ting nge 'dzin tshad med pa la spyod pa /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin tshad med pa la spyod pa /
translated: immeasurable conduct in samādhi,

original: shes rab dang / ye shes yul tshad med pa mnga' ba rnams lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten la phan 'dogs pa mdzad de /
analyzed: shes rab dang / ye shes yul tshad med pa mnga' ba rnams lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten la phan 'dogs pa mdzad de /
translated: immeasurable wisdom and knowledge, and they benefited the world with its gods.

original: bdud dang bcas @28b pa; tshangs pa dang bcas pa /
analyzed: bdud dang bcas @28b pa; tshangs pa dang bcas pa /
translated: They benefited the world with its Māra and Brahmā,

original: dge sbyong dang bram ze'i skye dgu dang bcas pa /
analyzed: dge sbyong dang bram ze'i skye dgu dang bcas pa /
translated: the world with its śramaṇas and brahmins,🔽and the world with its gods and humans.

original: lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten la phan 'dogs pa mdzad do //
analyzed: lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten la phan 'dogs pa mdzad do //
translated: He benefits the world of gods, humans, and demigods.

original: byams pa chen po'i spyod yul thogs pa med pa dang / thabs thugs rje chen po'i sgo'i mthar thug pas sems can la phan 'dogs pa mdzad do //
analyzed: byams pa chen po'i spyod yul thogs pa med pa dang / thabs thugs rje chen po'i sgo'i mthar thug pas sems can la phan 'dogs pa mdzad do //
translated: He benefits beings through the field of great love, which is unobstructed, and through the door of great compassion, which is the ultimate of skillful means.

original: bsod nams kyi stobs dang / mnga' phun sum tshogs pa dang / dbang po rnam par sbyang ba dang / cang shes kyi sems yongs su dag pas kyang sems can rnams la phan 'dogs pa mdzad do //
analyzed: bsod nams kyi stobs dang / mnga' phun sum tshogs pa dang / dbang po rnam par sbyang ba dang / cang shes kyi sems yongs su dag pas kyang sems can rnams la phan 'dogs pa mdzad do //
translated: He benefits beings through the power of merit, through the perfection of sovereignty, through the purification of the senses, and through the purity of the mind of self-control.

original: theg pa sna tshogs rnam par dag pas kyang sems can rnams la phan 'dogs pa mdzad do //
analyzed: theg pa sna tshogs rnam par dag pas kyang sems can rnams la phan 'dogs pa mdzad do //
translated: He benefits beings through the purification of the various vehicles.

original: theg pa chen po yongs su rdzogs par bya bas kyang sems can rnams la phan 'dogs par mdzad do //
analyzed: theg pa chen po yongs su rdzogs par bya bas kyang sems can rnams la phan 'dogs par mdzad do //
translated: He benefits beings through the perfection of the Great Vehicle.

original: 'gro ba thams cad gdon pas kyang sems can rnams la phan 'dogs pa mdzad de /
analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad gdon pas kyang sems can rnams la phan 'dogs pa mdzad de /
translated: He benefits beings through the rescue of all beings.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las dang po'o //
translated: This is the first deed of the buddhas, the blessed ones.

original: dga' ldan gyi pho brang nas 'phos pa med kyang yum gyi skur gshegs shing /
analyzed: dga' ldan gyi pho brang nas 'phos pa med kyang yum gyi skur gshegs shing /
translated: “Without moving from the palace of Tuṣita, they enter the womb of their mothers.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sku tha ma skye bar bstan pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sku tha ma skye bar bstan pa /
translated: They demonstrate taking birth in their final existence as bodhisattvas.

original: sgyu ma lta bur yongs su spyod pa /
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bur yongs su spyod pa /
translated: They experience the world like an illusion.

original: sprul pa lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi mthar thug pa /
analyzed: sprul pa lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi mthar thug pa /
translated: They have perfected the samādhi that is like a magical creation.

original: mig yor lta bur rnam par dmigs pa /
analyzed: mig yor lta bur rnam par dmigs pa /
translated: They perceive things like a mirage.

original: nam mkha'i yul tshad med par khyab pa /
analyzed: nam mkha'i yul tshad med par khyab pa /
translated: They pervade the immeasurable space realm.

original: bzhed pa bzhin du skye yang chags pa mi mnga' ba /
analyzed: bzhed pa bzhin du skye yang chags pa mi mnga' ba /
translated: They take birth as they wish, but they are not attached.

original: smig rgyu ba lta bur bstan pa /
analyzed: smig rgyu ba lta bur bstan pa /
translated: They demonstrate the world to be like a mirage.

original: nyon mongs pa med pa'i chos la yang dag par gzhol ba /🔽gnas med pa'i @29a *//
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa'i chos la yang dag par gzhol ba / gnas med pa'i @29a *//
translated: They are dedicated to the Dharma that is free of afflictions.🔽They are free of any abode.

original: ye shes la gnas pa /
analyzed: ye shes la gnas pa /
translated: They abide in the wisdom that is free of any abode.

original: rang bzhin gyis 'dod chags dang bral bas rnam par dag pa /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis 'dod chags dang bral bas rnam par dag pa /
translated: They are pure by being naturally free of desire.

original: rgyan shin tu rgya che ba'i mdzod kyis sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las mdzad do //
analyzed: rgyan shin tu rgya che ba'i mdzod kyis sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las mdzad do //
translated: They perform the deeds of a buddha with a treasury of vast adornments.

original: khang pa brtsegs pa rin po che las byas pa'i pho brang chen po rin po che'i rgyan mang po ldan pa na bzhugs pas kyang sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las mdzad do //
analyzed: khang pa brtsegs pa rin po che las byas pa'i pho brang chen po rin po che'i rgyan mang po ldan pa na bzhugs pas kyang sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las mdzad do //
translated: He performs buddha activities by dwelling in a great palace made of precious materials, with many precious ornaments.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyis kyang sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las mdzad do //🔽yid la bya ba byin gyi rlabs chen pos kyang sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las mdzad do //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyis kyang sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las mdzad do // yid la bya ba byin gyi rlabs chen pos kyang sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las mdzad do //
translated: He performs buddha activities through his miraculous powers.🔽He performs buddha activities through the great blessings of mental activity.

original: rnam par 'phrul ba'i mdzod chen po yang dag par bstan pas kyang sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las mdzad do //
analyzed: rnam par 'phrul ba'i mdzod chen po yang dag par bstan pas kyang sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las mdzad do //
translated: He performs buddha activities through the great treasury of emanations.

original: ye shes kyi nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor chen pos kyang sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las mdzad do //
analyzed: ye shes kyi nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor chen pos kyang sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las mdzad do //
translated: He performs buddha activities through the great orb of the sun of wisdom.

original: yum sku skyed pa'i sku na bzhugs pas kyang sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las mdzad do; ;sangs rgyas kyi yul gyi spyod yul chen po brnyes pas kyang sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las mdzad do //
analyzed: yum sku skyed pa'i sku na bzhugs pas kyang sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las mdzad do; ;sangs rgyas kyi yul gyi spyod yul chen po brnyes pas kyang sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las mdzad do //
translated: He performs buddha activities through the great womb of the mother of the buddhas. He performs buddha activities through the great domain of the buddha realm.

original: sangs rgyas kyi byin gyis 'jig rten byin du brlabs pa mtha' yas pas kyang sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las mdzad do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi byin gyis 'jig rten byin du brlabs pa mtha' yas pas kyang sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las mdzad do //
translated: He performs Buddha activities by means of the infinite blessings of the Buddhas, which bless the world.

original: ting nge 'dzin chen po grangs med pa la rnam par spyod cing snyoms par 'jug pas kyang sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las mdzad do //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin chen po grangs med pa la rnam par spyod cing snyoms par 'jug pas kyang sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las mdzad do //
translated: He performs Buddha activities by means of the infinite concentrations, by means of the practice and the attainment of them.

original: ting nge 'dzin las bzhengs pa de dang de dag gis kyang sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las mdzad do //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin las bzhengs pa de dang de dag gis kyang sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las mdzad do //
translated: He performs Buddha activities by means of the various concentrations and the rising from them.

original: spyod pa'i thog ma la yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mthar thug pa'i bar du thog ma dang / dbus dang / tha ma'i tshul @29b gyis kyang sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las mdzad do //
analyzed: spyod pa'i thog ma la yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mthar thug pa'i bar du thog ma dang / dbus dang / tha ma'i tshul @29b gyis kyang sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las mdzad do //
translated: He performs Buddha activities by means of the beginning of the practice, and by means of the final end of the great Nirvana, in the manner of beginning, middle, and end.

original: sa 'di la gnyis su med pa thams cad mthar phyin par byas nas tha mar 'jig rten gyi grangs kyis skye ba yongs su ston te /
analyzed: sa 'di la gnyis su med pa thams cad mthar phyin par byas nas tha mar 'jig rten gyi grangs kyis skye ba yongs su ston te /
translated: Having perfected all the non-dual aspects of this stage, he finally manifests birth by means of worldly reckoning.

original: skye bas kyang 'jig rten thams cad du sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las mdzad do //
analyzed: skye bas kyang 'jig rten thams cad du sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las mdzad do //
translated: By being born, he performs the deeds of a Buddha in all worlds.

original: gzhon nur gyur pas kyang 'jig rten thams cad du sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las mdzad do //
analyzed: gzhon nur gyur pas kyang 'jig rten thams cad du sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las mdzad do //
translated: By being a prince, he performs the deeds of a Buddha in all worlds.

original: byang chub sems dpar gyur pas kyang 'jig rten thams cad du sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las mdzad do //🔽mngon par 'byung bas kyang 'jig rten thams cad du sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las mdzad do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpar gyur pas kyang 'jig rten thams cad du sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las mdzad do // mngon par 'byung bas kyang 'jig rten thams cad du sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las mdzad do //
translated: By being a bodhisattva, he performs the deeds of a Buddha in all worlds.🔽By going forth, he performs the deeds of a Buddha in all worlds.

original: mngon par 'tshang rgya bas kyang 'jig rten thams cad du sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las mdzad do //
analyzed: mngon par 'tshang rgya bas kyang 'jig rten thams cad du sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las mdzad do //
translated: By attaining perfect buddhahood, he performs the deeds of a Buddha in all worlds.

original: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bas kyang 'jig rten thams cad du sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las mdzad do //
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bas kyang 'jig rten thams cad du sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las mdzad do //
translated: By turning the wheel of Dharma, he performs the deeds of a Buddha in all worlds.

original: thabs mkhas pa sna tshogs kyis kyang 'jig rten sna tshogs /
analyzed: thabs mkhas pa sna tshogs kyis kyang 'jig rten sna tshogs /
translated: By various skillful means, he performs the deeds of a Buddha in various worlds.

original: 'jig rten tshad med pa /
analyzed: 'jig rten tshad med pa /
translated: In immeasurable worlds,

original: 'jig rten kun tu mtha' yas pa phyogs kyi dra ba'i rgyud dang / rigs thams cad kyi 'jig rten ma lus pa thams cad du sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las mdzad do //🔽zhing gi rgyud ma lus pa'i 'jig rten du sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las mdzad do //
analyzed: 'jig rten kun tu mtha' yas pa phyogs kyi dra ba'i rgyud dang / rigs thams cad kyi 'jig rten ma lus pa thams cad du sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las mdzad do // zhing gi rgyud ma lus pa'i 'jig rten du sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las mdzad do //
translated: He performs the deeds of a Buddha in all the worlds of the realms of all the different kinds of universes.

original: las kyi rnam par smin pa ma lus pa'i 'jig rten du sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las mdzad do //
analyzed: las kyi rnam par smin pa ma lus pa'i 'jig rten du sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las mdzad do //
translated: He performs the deeds of a Buddha in all the worlds of the realms of all the different kinds of results of actions.

original: sems can gyi rgyud ma lus pa'i 'jig rten du sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las mdzad do //
analyzed: sems can gyi rgyud ma lus pa'i 'jig rten du sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las mdzad do //
translated: He performs the deeds of a Buddha in all the worlds of the realms of all the different kinds of beings.

original: skye ba dang shi 'pho ba'i rgyud ma lus pa'i 'jig rten du sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las mdzad do //🔽sprul pa chen @30a *//🔽po'i rgyud dang / sangs rgyas kyi rigs dang / chos dran pa'i sgo'i 'khor los kyang /
analyzed: skye ba dang shi 'pho ba'i rgyud ma lus pa'i 'jig rten du sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las mdzad do // sprul pa chen @30a *// po'i rgyud dang / sangs rgyas kyi rigs dang / chos dran pa'i sgo'i 'khor los kyang /
translated: He performs the deeds of a Buddha in all the worlds of the realms of all the different kinds of birth and death.🔽He performs the deeds of a Buddha in all the worlds of the realms of all the different kinds of emanations.🔽He performs the deeds of a Buddha through the wheel of the door of mindfulness of the Dharma of the Buddha family.

original: sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las mdzad de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las mdzad de /
translated: He performs the deeds of a Buddha through the wheel of the door of mindfulness of the Dharma of the family of the bodhisattvas.

original: 'di na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: 'di na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las gnyis pa'o //
translated: This is the second deed of the blessed buddhas.

original: dge bar spyod pa'i las rnam par dag cing /
analyzed: dge bar spyod pa'i las rnam par dag cing /
translated: “ ‘They manifest the pure conduct of virtue

original: gdung rabs thams cad du ye shes kyi tshul rnam par dag pas sku tshe'i rgyud kyi tshul dang ldan pa /
analyzed: gdung rabs thams cad du ye shes kyi tshul rnam par dag pas sku tshe'i rgyud kyi tshul dang ldan pa /
translated: and the way of life that is endowed with the pure way of wisdom in all their lifetimes.

original: sems can thams cad gdul ba thugs su chud pa /
analyzed: sems can thams cad gdul ba thugs su chud pa /
translated: They understand how to guide all sentient beings

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad yongs su rdzogs par mdzad cing btsun mo'i 'khor gyi nang na bzhugs pa ston kyang /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad yongs su rdzogs par mdzad cing btsun mo'i 'khor gyi nang na bzhugs pa ston kyang /
translated: and they manifest within the retinue of queens,🔽while at the same time they are beyond all sounds and words, and they understand that all things arise from the absence of substance.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba'i tshul gyi gnas la bzhugs pa rnams sgra dang / tshig thams cad dang bral bar brtags pas dngos po thams cad dngos po med pa las byung bar khong du chud par bya ba dang / dngos po thams cad shes pa la gzud par bya ba dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba'i tshul gyi gnas la bzhugs pa rnams sgra dang / tshig thams cad dang bral bar brtags pas dngos po thams cad dngos po med pa las byung bar khong du chud par bya ba dang / dngos po thams cad shes pa la gzud par bya ba dang /
translated: They cause all things to be understood in terms of consciousness.

original: tshul khrims thams cad thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi mthar thug par yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / snying rje chen pos 'gro ba mu med pa la rnam par blta bar bya ba dang / byams pa chen pos sems can med pa'i yul la rab tu rtog par bya ba dang /🔽dga' ba chen pos 'jig rten brjod du med par khong du chud par bya ba dang / btang snyoms chen pos sems la dbang sgyur ba la gnas par bya ba dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i yon tan gyis @30b rang yongs su rgyas par byed par bya ba dang /
analyzed: tshul khrims thams cad thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi mthar thug par yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / snying rje chen pos 'gro ba mu med pa la rnam par blta bar bya ba dang / byams pa chen pos sems can med pa'i yul la rab tu rtog par bya ba dang / dga' ba chen pos 'jig rten brjod du med par khong du chud par bya ba dang / btang snyoms chen pos sems la dbang sgyur ba la gnas par bya ba dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i yon tan gyis @30b rang yongs su rgyas par byed par bya ba dang /
translated: to perfect all discipline in the omniscience of buddhahood; to look with great compassion upon the infinite world of beings; to understand with great love the object that is devoid of sentient beings;🔽to comprehend with great joy the inexpressible world; to abide with great equanimity in the mastery of mind; to be filled with the qualities of omniscience;

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi lus ma lus par mngon par bsgrub par bya ba dang / thams cad du gnas med pa'i lus yongs su rdzogs par byed par bya ba dang / 'khor thams cad rnam par dag par nan tan du byed par bya ba dang /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi lus ma lus par mngon par bsgrub par bya ba dang / thams cad du gnas med pa'i lus yongs su rdzogs par byed par bya ba dang / 'khor thams cad rnam par dag par nan tan du byed par bya ba dang /
translated: to accomplish the body of the realm of phenomena in its entirety; to perfect the body that is not based anywhere; to be diligent in purifying all retinues;

original: chos bstan pa rnam par brjod pa rab tu brjod par bya ba dang / 'jig rten gyi dngos po la smod par bya ba dang / 'gro ba thams cad kyi nyes pa la rtog par bya ba mdzad cing spyod pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa bar rnam par smin pa yang dag par bstan pa dang /
analyzed: chos bstan pa rnam par brjod pa rab tu brjod par bya ba dang / 'jig rten gyi dngos po la smod par bya ba dang / 'gro ba thams cad kyi nyes pa la rtog par bya ba mdzad cing spyod pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa bar rnam par smin pa yang dag par bstan pa dang /
translated: He taught the Dharma, spoke of the expression of the Dharma, and spoke of what should be expressed. He criticized worldly things and contemplated the faults of all beings. He taught the ripening of roots of virtue.

original: ji ltar bkod pa'i tshul du sems can gdul ba dang / yongs su ma smin pa'i sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / yongs su smin pa rnams tshul bzhin du gdul ba dang / grangs med pa'i thabs mkhas pa mngon par sgrub pa dang /
analyzed: ji ltar bkod pa'i tshul du sems can gdul ba dang / yongs su ma smin pa'i sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / yongs su smin pa rnams tshul bzhin du gdul ba dang / grangs med pa'i thabs mkhas pa mngon par sgrub pa dang /
translated: He guided beings in accordance with the way they were arranged, ripened those beings who were not yet ripened, properly guided those who were ripened, and accomplished countless skillful means.

original: sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las phyir mi ldog pa yongs su bstan pa dang / sgo sna tshogs nas chos kyi spyod pa rab tu brjod pa dang / sems can rnams kyi bsam pa sna tshogs rnam par sbyang ba dang / thugs rje chen po las byung ba'i chos kyi sprin gyis mngon par spang ba dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las phyir mi ldog pa yongs su bstan pa dang / sgo sna tshogs nas chos kyi spyod pa rab tu brjod pa dang / sems can rnams kyi bsam pa sna tshogs rnam par sbyang ba dang / thugs rje chen po las byung ba'i chos kyi sprin gyis mngon par spang ba dang /
translated: the cloud of Dharma that arises from great compassion,🔽the three miracles that are moistened by the great love that protects all,🔽the display of the retinue of queens who see and perceive all buddhas,

original: thams cad la skyob pa'i byams pa chen po bskyed pa'i cho 'phrul gsum gyis yongs su brlan pa dang / sangs rgyas thams cad mthong ba dang / rnam par dmigs pa'i btsun mo'i 'khor gyi nang du bstan pa yan chad du 'jig rten mtha' dang dbus med par sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las yongs su bstan pa @31a *//
analyzed: thams cad la skyob pa'i byams pa chen po bskyed pa'i cho 'phrul gsum gyis yongs su brlan pa dang / sangs rgyas thams cad mthong ba dang / rnam par dmigs pa'i btsun mo'i 'khor gyi nang du bstan pa yan chad du 'jig rten mtha' dang dbus med par sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las yongs su bstan pa @31a *//
translated: and the display of the activity of the buddhas in the world without end or middle.

original: mdzad cing / ye shes kyi mthu chen po thogs pa med pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi mngon par mkhyen pa bsgribs pa med par bsgrubs pa dang / chos rnam pa gsum gyis thabs mkhas pa dang ldan pa'i 'phrin las kyi mtha' dang / sku'i 'phrin las kyi mtha' shin tu rnam par dag pa dang /
analyzed: mdzad cing / ye shes kyi mthu chen po thogs pa med pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi mngon par mkhyen pa bsgribs pa med par bsgrubs pa dang / chos rnam pa gsum gyis thabs mkhas pa dang ldan pa'i 'phrin las kyi mtha' dang / sku'i 'phrin las kyi mtha' shin tu rnam par dag pa dang /
translated: and with the great, unobstructed power of wisdom, the unobstructed higher knowledge of the buddhas, and the three kinds of Dharma, he has the activity of skillful means.🔽He has the activity of the body, which is extremely pure;

original: gsung gi 'phrin las ye shes nyams pa med pas rnam par dag pa dang / thugs kyi 'phrin las kyi mtha' zab cing chags pa med pa'i mthar thug pa'i thabs la mkhas pas sems can rnams kyi don mdzad de /
analyzed: gsung gi 'phrin las ye shes nyams pa med pas rnam par dag pa dang / thugs kyi 'phrin las kyi mtha' zab cing chags pa med pa'i mthar thug pa'i thabs la mkhas pas sems can rnams kyi don mdzad de /
translated: the activity of speech, which is pure because of unimpaired wisdom; and the activity of mind, which is the ultimate skillful means that is profound and free of attachment.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las gsum pa'o ////🔽bam po drug cu lnga pa /
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las gsum pa'o ////🔽bam po drug cu lnga pa /
translated: This is the third activity of the bhagavān buddhas.

original: rnam par rgyal ba chen po mnga' ba rnams ni btsun mo'i 'khor rgyan rnam par skye ba tshad med pa dang ldan pa yid du 'ong ba spangs te /🔽mngon par 'byung ba'i spyod pa yongs su bstan pas sems can rnams 'jig rten gyi gnas las bskyod pa dang / 'jig rten gyi mngon par zhen pa rnam par bzlog pa dang / 'jig rten du gtogs pa thams cad mi rtag par shes par bya ba dang /
analyzed: rnam par rgyal ba chen po mnga' ba rnams ni btsun mo'i 'khor rgyan rnam par skye ba tshad med pa dang ldan pa yid du 'ong ba spangs te / mngon par 'byung ba'i spyod pa yongs su bstan pas sems can rnams 'jig rten gyi gnas las bskyod pa dang / 'jig rten gyi mngon par zhen pa rnam par bzlog pa dang / 'jig rten du gtogs pa thams cad mi rtag par shes par bya ba dang /
translated: abandon the retinue of queens, who have immeasurable, delightful ornaments,🔽in order to demonstrate the conduct of leaving home.🔽They do so in order to cause beings to leave the abodes of the world, to turn away from their attachment to the world, to understand that everything in the world is impermanent,

original: 'jig rten gyi tshul la mngon par zhen pa rnam par bzlog pa dang 'jig rten gyi dga' ba la sred pa yongs su bcad pa dang / 'jig rten gyi nyon mongs pa byang zhing nub pa la yang dag par spyod par bya ba dang / sems can gyi don rjes su dran @31b par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi tshul la mngon par zhen pa rnam par bzlog pa dang 'jig rten gyi dga' ba la sred pa yongs su bcad pa dang / 'jig rten gyi nyon mongs pa byang zhing nub pa la yang dag par spyod par bya ba dang / sems can gyi don rjes su dran @31b par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: to turn away from attachment to worldly ways, to cut off craving for worldly pleasures, to engage in the purification and subsiding of worldly afflictions, and to remember the welfare of beings.

original: mngon par 'byung ba'i don la rab tu gzhol ba dang / khyim pa'i tshul yongs su spang ba bstan pa dang / nyon mongs pa med pa'i chos kyi sbyor ba la yang dag par gnas par bya ba dang; sngon gyi smon lam yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang /
analyzed: mngon par 'byung ba'i don la rab tu gzhol ba dang / khyim pa'i tshul yongs su spang ba bstan pa dang / nyon mongs pa med pa'i chos kyi sbyor ba la yang dag par gnas par bya ba dang; sngon gyi smon lam yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang /
translated: to be dedicated to the meaning of going forth; to teach the abandonment of the householder’s way of life; to be established in the application of the Dharma of the absence of afflictions; to fulfill past aspirations;

original: yon tan gyi dkyil 'khor tshad med pa yongs su snang bar bya ba dang / ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor chen po brnyes pas sems can rnams kyi mi shes pa'i sgrib pa rab tu bsal ba dang / bdag nyid bsod nams kyi zhing bla na med par gyur par 'gro ba thams cad la bstan pa dang /
analyzed: yon tan gyi dkyil 'khor tshad med pa yongs su snang bar bya ba dang / ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor chen po brnyes pas sems can rnams kyi mi shes pa'i sgrib pa rab tu bsal ba dang / bdag nyid bsod nams kyi zhing bla na med par gyur par 'gro ba thams cad la bstan pa dang /
translated: to illuminate the immeasurable maṇḍala of qualities; to remove the obscurations of ignorance of beings through attaining the great maṇḍala of wisdom; to teach all beings that he himself is the unsurpassed field of merit;

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad sangs rgyas la bskyed pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i nang du 'dus par 'gro ba thams cad la yang dag par brjod pa dang / bdag nyid kyis ye shes kyi don gzigs par bstan pa dang / sems can rnams rnam par dag pa'i sgor brjod pa dang /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad sangs rgyas la bskyed pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i nang du 'dus par 'gro ba thams cad la yang dag par brjod pa dang / bdag nyid kyis ye shes kyi don gzigs par bstan pa dang / sems can rnams rnam par dag pa'i sgor brjod pa dang /
translated: He proclaims to all beings the perfect expression of the roots of virtue that are included within the roots of virtue that are generated toward the Buddha, and he reveals the vision of the meaning of gnosis by himself.

original: sems can rnams kha na ma tho ba med pa'i sgor sgrub pa dang / 'jig rten thams cad du 'byung ba'i sgo rab tu bstan pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rgyal mtshan yang dag par bsgreng ba mdzad cing mngon par 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: sems can rnams kha na ma tho ba med pa'i sgor sgrub pa dang / 'jig rten thams cad du 'byung ba'i sgo rab tu bstan pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rgyal mtshan yang dag par bsgreng ba mdzad cing mngon par 'byung ba ste /
translated: He establishes beings in the door of purity, and he accomplishes beings in the door of non-transgression. He reveals the door of appearance in all worlds, and he raises the banner of omniscience.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las bzhi pa'o //
translated: This is the fourth activity of the Bhagavat Buddhas.

original: don gcig ma yin pa mkhyen pa dang ldan pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi mthar thug pa rnams ni /
analyzed: don gcig ma yin pa mkhyen pa dang ldan pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi mthar thug pa rnams ni /
translated: Those who possess the knowledge of the single meaning, who have reached the culmination of the gnosis of omniscience,

original: chos thams cad mngon par 'tshang rgya bar bya'o zhes byang chub kyi shing drung du byon te /
analyzed: chos thams cad mngon par 'tshang rgya bar bya'o zhes byang chub kyi shing drung du byon te /
translated: He went to the foot of the Bodhi tree, thinking, “I will fully awaken to all phenomena.”

original: byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang @32a *//
analyzed: byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang @32a *//
translated: He fully awakened to awakening

original: rgya bas kyang bdud kyi dpung thams cad rab tu gzhom pa dang / sku'i byin gyi rlabs kyi mdzod kyi chos kyi dbyings ma lus pa thams cad du rgyas par dgang ba'i phyir; byin gyi rlabs zad mi shes pa'i mthar thug pas mtha' rnam par spangs pa spyod pa tshad med pa rab tu brnyes pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i yul gyis
analyzed: rgya bas kyang bdud kyi dpung thams cad rab tu gzhom pa dang / sku'i byin gyi rlabs kyi mdzod kyi chos kyi dbyings ma lus pa thams cad du rgyas par dgang ba'i phyir; byin gyi rlabs zad mi shes pa'i mthar thug pas mtha' rnam par spangs pa spyod pa tshad med pa rab tu brnyes pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i yul gyis
translated: and defeated all the armies of Māra. In order to fill the entire realm of phenomena with the treasury of the blessings of his body, he attained the infinite, inexhaustible blessings that are beyond extremes and are the practice of the immeasurable.

original: rnam par rol pa'i ye shes kyi don dang ldan pa /
analyzed: rnam par rol pa'i ye shes kyi don dang ldan pa /
translated: He was endowed with the meaning of the wisdom that plays in the domain of omniscience.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i yon tan yang dag par sgrub pa yongs su rdzogs pa /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i yon tan yang dag par sgrub pa yongs su rdzogs pa /
translated: He had perfected the accomplishment of the qualities of omniscience.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams ma lus pa thams cad du gdan rnam par bkram pas yongs su rgyas pa /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams ma lus pa thams cad du gdan rnam par bkram pas yongs su rgyas pa /
translated: He was filled with the spread of seats throughout all the worlds.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing ma lus pa thams cad du byang chub sems dpa' rnam par dmigs pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing ma lus pa thams cad du byang chub sems dpa' rnam par dmigs pa /

analyzed: chos ston pas kyang sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las rgyun mi 'chad do //

analyzed: sangs rgyas gcig brjod pas kyang sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las rgyun mi 'chad do //

analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad brjod pas kyang sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las rgyun mi 'chad do //

translated: The explanation of a single bodhisattva activity as if it were distinct activities also constitutes the uninterrupted activity of the Buddha.🔽The expression of the mundane realm as the realm of the Buddha also constitutes the uninterrupted activity of the Buddha.🔽The expression of the realm of the Buddha as the mundane realm also constitutes the uninterrupted activity of the Buddha.

translated: The expression of what is not an object as the object of the Buddha also constitutes the uninterrupted activity of the Buddha.

original: nyin mtshan dang / yud du yan man dang / zla ba dang / lo 'grangs par bzhugs pa dang / yongs su bzhugs pa nas de bzhin du bskal pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i bar du bzhugs pa dang / yongs su bzhugs pas kyang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams sems can rnams la sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las mdzad de /
analyzed: nyin mtshan dang / yud du yan man dang / zla ba dang / lo 'grangs par bzhugs pa dang / yongs su bzhugs pa nas de bzhin du bskal pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i bar du bzhugs pa dang / yongs su bzhugs pas kyang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams sems can rnams la sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las mdzad de /
translated: They remain and dwell for days and nights, for periods, for the four seasons, for months and years, and similarly for as long as it takes to empty out the three realms, and for as long as it takes to remain and dwell for as many eons as there are atoms in an inexpressible number of inexpressibly many buddha-realms.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las brgyad pa'o //
translated: This is the eighth deed of the buddhas, the transcendent conquerors.🔽The buddhas, the transcendent conquerors, are like a source of roots of virtue for all sentient beings.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams la 'byung gnas lta bu sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa kun la rnam par sbyong ba lta bu /

original: sems khong du chud par bya ba la shin tu mos pa lta bu /
analyzed: sems khong du chud par bya ba la shin tu mos pa lta bu /
translated: They are like the delight in the mind.

original: dbang po rnams la sgrub pa lta bu /

original: sems can skye dgu thams cad la 'dul ba lta bu /

original: 'gro ba thams cad la mos pa lta bu /

original: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la 'byung ba lta bu /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la 'byung ba lta bu /

translated: The transcendent lords teach that the world is impermanent, that the activity of the buddhas is uninterrupted, that the activity of the buddhas is inexhaustible, and that the continuity of the teaching is never interrupted.

original: srid pa'i tshul rtsa ba nas chad @37a *//
analyzed: srid pa'i tshul rtsa ba nas chad @37a *//

analyzed: par brjod pa dang / sems can thams cad skyo bar bya bar bstan pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi rjes su 'gro ba'i sems su mthun par bya ba dang / sku tshe'i mtha' lta bur sems can rnams kyis shes par bya ba dang / sems can rnams kyis 'jig rten thams cad du dga' bar bya ba med par bstan pa dang /

analyzed: yongs su dag par mdzad pa dang / sangs rgyas la mos pa bskyed pa dang / skyo bar gyur ba'i sems can rnams la byin gyis brlab par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas la dmigs pa'i rkyen 'jig rten gyi khams ma lus pa thams cad du phyin par dgongs pa mdzad pa dang /
translated: and to purify it; to generate devotion to the buddhas; to give blessings to beings who are weary; to think of going to all the worlds without exception in the circumstances of being dedicated to the buddhas;

original: sku thams cad bshig ste /
analyzed: sku thams cad bshig ste /
translated: to destroy all bodies;

translated: They also take care of sentient beings through the relics of the Thus-Gone One, and they display their parinirvāṇa in order to tame the agitated and arrogant beings in the turbulent worlds.🔽

original: sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las rgyun mi 'chad de /

analyzed: bzhengs sam / gzims kyang rung ste /

original: med par mi 'gyur ro //🔽mi g-yo / mi 'byung /
analyzed: med par mi 'gyur ro // mi g-yo / mi 'byung /
translated: It never ceases to be.

original: mi 'jig go /
analyzed: mi 'jig go /
translated: It does not move, arise, or perish.

original: de bzhin du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyang ba spu'i khung bu gcig tu 'jig rten gyi khams ma lus pa thams cad bsnams kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyang ba spu'i khung bu gcig tu 'jig rten gyi khams ma lus pa thams cad bsnams kyang /
translated: In the same way, the blessed buddhas hold all the worlds in a single pore,

original: de'i rgyus thugs skad cig tsam du yang mi bde ba'i sku nyams mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: de'i rgyus thugs skad cig tsam du yang mi bde ba'i sku nyams mi 'byung ste /
translated: and yet their minds are never uncomfortable for even a moment, nor do their bodies suffer.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi mthu bo che chen po'i stobs /
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi mthu bo che chen po'i stobs /
translated: This is the great power of the great strength of the blessed buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi spyod pa'i rgyal mtshan gyi chos gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi spyod pa'i rgyal mtshan gyi chos gnyis pa'o //
translated: This is the second quality of the banner of the buddhas’ conduct.

original: gzhan yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams gshegs stabs gcig tu bzhud pas sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams yongs su 'da' zhing thugs bskyed pa gcig gis bskal pa tha dad
analyzed: gzhan yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams gshegs stabs gcig tu bzhud pas sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams yongs su 'da' zhing thugs bskyed pa gcig gis bskal pa tha dad
translated: “Moreover, the blessed buddhas travel in a single stride, passing worlds as numerous as the atoms in an anabhilāpyānabhilāpya­parivarta of buddhafields.

original: pa'i @43a *// rim pas sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed 'byung bar mdzad do //
analyzed: pa'i @43a *// rim pas sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed 'byung bar mdzad do //
translated: In a single thought, they manifest kalpas as numerous as the atoms in an anabhilāpyānabhilāpya­parivarta of buddhafields.

original: de lta bur gshegs pas bskal pa 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed du gshegs shing /
analyzed: de lta bur gshegs pas bskal pa 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed du gshegs shing /
translated: In this way, they travel for kalpas as numerous as the atoms in all world systems.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi sems kyi rgyud ji snyed pa'i bskal par bzhud de /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi sems kyi rgyud ji snyed pa'i bskal par bzhud de /
translated: He entered into the mental continuums of all sentient beings in all world systems for as many eons as there are atomic particles in all world systems.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams tsam du 'khor kun tu rgya che zhing yangs pa'i khor yug chen po'i rdo rje'i ri dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rnam pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa la bsgres pa snyed kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyang de la bsgres pa de snyed ba spu'i khung bu gcig tu btsud de /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams tsam du 'khor kun tu rgya che zhing yangs pa'i khor yug chen po'i rdo rje'i ri dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rnam pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa la bsgres pa snyed kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyang de la bsgres pa de snyed ba spu'i khung bu gcig tu btsud de /
translated: He entered into as many world systems as there are atomic particles in all world systems, and he entered into as many world systems as there are atomic particles in all world systems multiplied by a number equal to the number of atoms in a world system multiplied by a number equal to the number of atoms in all world systems.

original: ba spu'i khung bu gcig tu ji lta ba bzhin du sku'i ba spu'i khung bu thams cad du btsud de /
analyzed: ba spu'i khung bu gcig tu ji lta ba bzhin du sku'i ba spu'i khung bu thams cad du btsud de /
translated: He entered into all the pores of his body, and just as he entered into one pore, he entered into all the pores of his body.

original: ba spu'i khung bu yang sems can thams cad snyed du gyur la de dag thams cad bsnams te /
analyzed: ba spu'i khung bu yang sems can thams cad snyed du gyur la de dag thams cad bsnams te /
translated: He entered into as many pores as there are sentient beings, and he entered into all of them.

original: de snyed kyi ba spu'i khung bur tshul de bzhin du bshams te; thugs bskyed pa de lta bus de bzhin gshegs pa 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du rgyu zhing gshegs sam /🔽phyogs kyi dra ba thams cad du rgyu zhing gshegs sam /
analyzed: de snyed kyi ba spu'i khung bur tshul de bzhin du bshams te; thugs bskyed pa de lta bus de bzhin gshegs pa 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du rgyu zhing gshegs sam / phyogs kyi dra ba thams cad du rgyu zhing gshegs sam /
translated: Does the Tathāgata go to all the world-realms?🔽Does he go to all the nets of directions?

original: nam mkha'i dbyings thams cad du rgyu zhing gshegs sam /
analyzed: nam mkha'i dbyings thams cad du rgyu zhing gshegs sam /
translated: Does he go to all the realms of space?

original: 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgyud 'grangs pa sngon gyi mthar gtogs pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgyud 'grangs pa sngon gyi mthar gtogs pa nas bzung ste /
translated: From the beginning of the world-system up to the end of the future,

original: phyi ma'i mtha'i bskal pa'i mur thug @43b par de bzhin du gshegs pas bskal pa thams cad zad par gyur kyang de bzhin gshegs pa bzhud pa la brtson pa ni nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyi ma'i mtha'i bskal pa'i mur thug @43b par de bzhin du gshegs pas bskal pa thams cad zad par gyur kyang de bzhin gshegs pa bzhud pa la brtson pa ni nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: the Tathāgata goes to all the world-realms. Even if all the eons were to end, the Tathāgata’s going would not diminish.

original: sku nyam chung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sku nyam chung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: His body would not become weak.

original: thugs rnam par 'khrug par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thugs rnam par 'khrug par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: His mind would not become disturbed.

original: ting nge 'dzin nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: His samādhi would not diminish.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur te /
translated: The Tathāgata’s body would not diminish.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi mthu bo che chen po'i stobs /
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi mthu bo che chen po'i stobs /
translated: This is the great power of the great strength of the Bhagavat Buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi spyod pa'i rgyal mtshan gyi chos gsum pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi spyod pa'i rgyal mtshan gyi chos gsum pa'o //
translated: This is the third doctrine of the victory banner of the conduct of the Buddha.

original: gzhan yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni bsod snyoms gcig bzhes nas bskal pa brjod du med par skyil mo krung gcig bcas pas nyin mtshan gyi rgyud du sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha'i mur gtogs pa'i bskal pa 'das par bzhugs kyang sku mi g-yo zhing bde ba'i dam pa la spyod pa dang /🔽sangs rgyas kyi rnam par spyod pa bsam gyis mi khyab pas rnam par spyod kyang sems can 'ga' tsam la'ang /
analyzed: gzhan yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni bsod snyoms gcig bzhes nas bskal pa brjod du med par skyil mo krung gcig bcas pas nyin mtshan gyi rgyud du sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha'i mur gtogs pa'i bskal pa 'das par bzhugs kyang sku mi g-yo zhing bde ba'i dam pa la spyod pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi rnam par spyod pa bsam gyis mi khyab pas rnam par spyod kyang sems can 'ga' tsam la'ang /
translated: Moreover, the Bhagavat Buddhas, having accepted a single alms-offering, remain for inexpressible eons in a single cross-legged posture, passing the eons of the past and future in the continuity of day and night, without moving their bodies, and experience the highest bliss.

original: sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las rgyun 'chad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las rgyun 'chad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Although they experience the inconceivable conduct of the Buddha, the activity of the Buddha is never interrupted for even a single being.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku de la 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad yongs su bkod do /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku de la 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad yongs su bkod do /
translated: The entire world-system is arranged in that body of the Tathagata.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams de dag gi sems can gcig gi lus kyang 'jig rten gyi khams sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed tsam du che ba de lta bur gyur la /🔽sems can gcig @44a *//
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams de dag gi sems can gcig gi lus kyang 'jig rten gyi khams sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed tsam du che ba de lta bur gyur la / sems can gcig @44a *//
translated: The body of a single being in those world systems would be as large as the world systems of inexpressibly numerous, inexpressible numbers of buddha realms.

original: gi lus kyi tshad ji tsam pa de tsam gyi lus su sems can thams cad kyang gyur la /
analyzed: gi lus kyi tshad ji tsam pa de tsam gyi lus su sems can thams cad kyang gyur la /
translated: The bodies of all beings would be the same size as the body of a single being.

original: sems can de dag re re'i gzugs kyang 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi lcid ji tsam yod pa de tsam du gyur te /
analyzed: sems can de dag re re'i gzugs kyang 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi lcid ji tsam yod pa de tsam du gyur te /
translated: The weight of each of those beings would be the same as the weight of all the world systems.

original: sems can gcig ji ltar lci ba bzhin du sems can thams cad re re'i lcid kyang de tsam du 'gyur te /
analyzed: sems can gcig ji ltar lci ba bzhin du sems can thams cad re re'i lcid kyang de tsam du 'gyur te /
translated: Just as the weight of a single being would be, so would the weight of each and every being.

original: sems can de dag thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i phyag sor gyi rtse mo gcig la phyi ma'i mtha'i bskal pa'i mur thug par bsnams te /
analyzed: sems can de dag thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i phyag sor gyi rtse mo gcig la phyi ma'i mtha'i bskal pa'i mur thug par bsnams te /
translated: All those beings would be held by a single fingertip of the Tathagata until the end of the eon.

original: phyag sor gyi rtse mo gcig gis ji ltar bsnams pa de bzhin du phyag sor thams cad kyi rtse mo la'ang de tsam re re bsnams kyang /
analyzed: phyag sor gyi rtse mo gcig gis ji ltar bsnams pa de bzhin du phyag sor thams cad kyi rtse mo la'ang de tsam re re bsnams kyang /
translated: In the same way, the tips of all the fingers of his hands are also each like that.

original: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa la sku mnyel ba'am /
analyzed: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa la sku mnyel ba'am /
translated: Therefore, the Tathāgata does not experience physical fatigue or

original: thugs dub par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: thugs dub par mi 'gyur te /
translated: mental exhaustion.

original: thugs bskyed pa'i cha shas shin tu phra ba gcig tsam du yang sdug bsngal mi bde ba skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thugs bskyed pa'i cha shas shin tu phra ba gcig tsam du yang sdug bsngal mi bde ba skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Not even a single very subtle part of his mental generation experiences suffering or discomfort.

original: de bzhin du 'jig rten gyi khams la 'jug pa dang / nam mkha'i dbyings la 'jug pa dang / phyogs kyi dra ba'i rnam pa la 'jug pa re re dang / de lta bu la 'jug pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'jig rten gyi khams la 'jug pa dang / nam mkha'i dbyings la 'jug pa dang / phyogs kyi dra ba'i rnam pa la 'jug pa re re dang / de lta bu la 'jug pa /
translated: In the same way, each of the entrances into the world systems, the entrances into the realm of space, the entrances into the aspects of the net of Indra, and the entrances into those like that

original: nam mkha'i khams ma lus pa'i dbyings kyis klas pa /
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams ma lus pa'i dbyings kyis klas pa /
translated: pervade the entire realm of space.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi mthas gtugs pa /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi mthas gtugs pa /
translated: They extend to the end of the realm of phenomena.

original: skra'i rtse mo'i cha shas kyis gzhal ba'i 'jig rten gyi khams la 'jug pa thams cad re re zhing yang skra'i rtse mo'i cha shas kyis gzhal te /
analyzed: skra'i rtse mo'i cha shas kyis gzhal ba'i 'jig rten gyi khams la 'jug pa thams cad re re zhing yang skra'i rtse mo'i cha shas kyis gzhal te /
translated: Each of the entrances into the world systems that are measured by parts of the tips of the hairs is measured by parts of the tips of the hairs.

original: nam mkha'i dbyings kyi kun tu khyab pa thams cad ma @44b lus pa'i skra'i rtse mo'i cha shas kyi tshad kyis nam mkha'i dbyings la 'jug pa thams cad du zhugs te /
analyzed: nam mkha'i dbyings kyi kun tu khyab pa thams cad ma @44b lus pa'i skra'i rtse mo'i cha shas kyi tshad kyis nam mkha'i dbyings la 'jug pa thams cad du zhugs te /
translated: They pervade the entire realm of space, and they enter into every part of the realm of space, even the parts as small as the tip of a hair.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod lam 'di'i tshul dang / skyil mo krung gcig tu bzhugs pa'i spyod pas sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa'i bskal pa zad par mdzad de /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod lam 'di'i tshul dang / skyil mo krung gcig tu bzhugs pa'i spyod pas sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa'i bskal pa zad par mdzad de /
translated: In this way, with the conduct of the tathāgatas, they remain in a single cross-legged posture and make the eons of the past and the future come to an end.

original: bskal pa 'da' bar mdzad cing bskal pa la rab tu 'jug ste /
analyzed: bskal pa 'da' bar mdzad cing bskal pa la rab tu 'jug ste /
translated: They transcend the eons and enter into the eons.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi mthu bo che chen po'i stobs /
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi mthu bo che chen po'i stobs /
translated: This is the great power of the mighty strength of the blessed buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi spyod pa'i rgyal mtshan gyi chos bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi spyod pa'i rgyal mtshan gyi chos bzhi pa'o //
translated: This is the fourth quality of the victory banner of the buddhas’ conduct.

original: gzhan yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni sku gcig la dbu sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed byin gyis brlabs te /🔽dbu re re la ljags sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed byin gyis brlabs nas /
analyzed: gzhan yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni sku gcig la dbu sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed byin gyis brlabs te / dbu re re la ljags sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed byin gyis brlabs nas /
translated: Moreover, the bhagavān buddhas bless their bodies to have as many heads as there are smallest particles in an inexpressibly inexpressible number of buddha realms.🔽Blessing each head to have as many tongues as there are smallest particles in an inexpressibly inexpressible number of buddha realms,

original: de dag re res kyang dbyangs kyi yan lag dang / sgra skad kyi gsung sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed re re brjod de /
analyzed: de dag re res kyang dbyangs kyi yan lag dang / sgra skad kyi gsung sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed re re brjod de /
translated: each tongue expresses as many aspects of speech with its melodious tones and sounds as there are smallest particles in an inexpressibly inexpressible number of buddha realms.

original: chos kyi dbyings ma lus pa'i sems can gyi khams thams cad go bar mdzad cing dbyangs kyi yan lag dang / sgra skad kyi gsung re res kyang mdo sde sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed bshad la /🔽mdo sde re re la yang chos bstan pa /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings ma lus pa'i sems can gyi khams thams cad go bar mdzad cing dbyangs kyi yan lag dang / sgra skad kyi gsung re res kyang mdo sde sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed bshad la / mdo sde re re la yang chos bstan pa /
translated: He makes the whole realm of sentient beings, which is the whole of the dharmadhatu, understand, and with each of his melodious voices and sounds he explains as many sutras as there are atoms in a million countless buddha realms.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med @45a *//🔽pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed rab tu gzhol bar mdzad de /🔽chos bstan pa gcig las kyang chos kyi tshig dang / yi ge sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed brjod par gyur la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med @45a *// pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed rab tu gzhol bar mdzad de / chos bstan pa gcig las kyang chos kyi tshig dang / yi ge sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed brjod par gyur la /
translated: And in each sutra he expounds as many teachings as there are atoms in a million countless buddha realms.🔽And in each teaching he expounds as many words and letters of the Dharma as there are atoms in a million countless buddha realms.

original: chos bstan pa gcig las ji lta ba bzhin du chos bstan pa thams cad las kyang de snyed kyi chos kyi tshig dang / yi ge brjod de /
analyzed: chos bstan pa gcig las ji lta ba bzhin du chos bstan pa thams cad las kyang de snyed kyi chos kyi tshig dang / yi ge brjod de /
translated: And in each word and letter of the Dharma he expounds as many words and letters of the Dharma as there are atoms in a million countless buddha realms.

original: de ltar brjod pas bskal pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed du rab tu bstan la /🔽bskal pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed zad par gyur kyang /
analyzed: de ltar brjod pas bskal pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed du rab tu bstan la / bskal pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed zad par gyur kyang /
translated: In this way, he taught for as many eons as there are atoms in an anabhilāpyānabhilāpya of buddha realms,🔽and even though he taught for as many eons as there are atoms in an anabhilāpyānabhilāpya of buddha realms,

original: da dung gzhan yang bskal pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed du brgyud cing rab tu ston pa'i tshul gyi rnam grangs 'dis bskal pa 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi rdul shin tu phra ba🔽snyed du rab tu bstan la /
analyzed: da dung gzhan yang bskal pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed du brgyud cing rab tu ston pa'i tshul gyi rnam grangs 'dis bskal pa 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi rdul shin tu phra ba🔽snyed du rab tu bstan la /
translated: he still taught for as many eons as there are atoms in all the world systems in the ten directions,🔽and he still teaches for as many eons as there are atoms in all the world systems in the ten directions.

original: rnam grangs 'di 'dra bas bskal pa 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed zad la sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod pa snyed kyi bskal pa 'das par gyur te; phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa'i bskal pa zad cing 'das par
analyzed: rnam grangs 'di 'dra bas bskal pa 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed zad la sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod pa snyed kyi bskal pa 'das par gyur te; phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa'i bskal pa zad cing 'das par
translated: “In this way, for as many eons as there are atoms in all the world systems, for as many eons as there are thoughts in all beings, the eons will come to an end, and the eons will be exhausted and pass into the final limit of the future.

original: byas kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa chos thams cad snang ba'i 'khor lo bskor ba dang / chos thams cad @45b rab tu shes par bstan cing lung bstan pa dang / the tshom thams cad rab tu gcod pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dang /
analyzed: byas kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa chos thams cad snang ba'i 'khor lo bskor ba dang / chos thams cad @45b rab tu shes par bstan cing lung bstan pa dang / the tshom thams cad rab tu gcod pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dang /
translated: “The emanations of the Tathāgata will turn the wheel of the Dharma that is the illumination of all phenomena, will teach and give prophecies that are the knowledge of all phenomena, and will turn the wheel of the Dharma that cuts through all doubt.

original: chos thams cad snang bar byed pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dang; byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad brjod pa'i rgyun dang ldan pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dang / ye shes kyi nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor chen po'i rgyan dang ldan pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dang /
analyzed: chos thams cad snang bar byed pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dang; byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad brjod pa'i rgyun dang ldan pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dang / ye shes kyi nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor chen po'i rgyan dang ldan pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dang /
translated: the wheel of Dharma that illuminates all phenomena, the wheel of Dharma that is endowed with the continuity of the expression of all the bodhisattva practices, the wheel of Dharma that is endowed with the ornament of the great orb of the sun of wisdom,

original: 'gro ba thams cad ma lus pa'i ye shes kyi sgron ma chen pos brgyan pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dang / tha dad pa yang dag par mkhyen pa dang / mi 'jigs pa chen pos brgyan pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba rgyun mi 'chad de /
analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad ma lus pa'i ye shes kyi sgron ma chen pos brgyan pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dang / tha dad pa yang dag par mkhyen pa dang / mi 'jigs pa chen pos brgyan pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba rgyun mi 'chad de /
translated: the wheel of Dharma that is adorned with the great lamp of wisdom of all beings without exception, and the wheel of Dharma that is adorned with the great fearlessness of the knowledge of distinctions.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sku gcig gi byin gyi rlabs kyis ji lta ba de bzhin du chos kyi 'khor lo'i sprin chen po dpe thams cad la dpe med par rab tu 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sku gcig gi byin gyi rlabs kyis ji lta ba de bzhin du chos kyi 'khor lo'i sprin chen po dpe thams cad la dpe med par rab tu 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as it is with the blessing of a single buddha body, so it is with the great cloud of the wheel of Dharma, which is beyond all analogies.

original: de bzhin du chos kyi dbyings ma lus pa thams cad kyi nam mkha'i dbyings kyi mthas gtugs pa skra'i rtse mo'i cha shas kyis gzhal ba ma lus pa thams cad chags pa med par rnam par dbye bas /
analyzed: de bzhin du chos kyi dbyings ma lus pa thams cad kyi nam mkha'i dbyings kyi mthas gtugs pa skra'i rtse mo'i cha shas kyis gzhal ba ma lus pa thams cad chags pa med par rnam par dbye bas /
translated: In the same way, all the parts of the sky element of the entire realm of phenomena, which are measured by the parts of the tip of a hair, are all without attachment, being divided up.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa snyed kyi sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa de snyed de snyed du thugs kyi skad cig re re la phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa'i bskal par sprul pa mdzad cing /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa snyed kyi sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa de snyed de snyed du thugs kyi skad cig re re la phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa'i bskal par sprul pa mdzad cing /
translated: In the same way, in every instant of mind, for as many kalpas as there are atoms in every part of the sky element of the entire realm of phenomena, he emanates that many buddhas, that many emanations, without attachment, in every part of the sky element of the entire realm of phenomena, as many as can be measured by the parts of the tip of a single hair.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa'i sku thams cad las de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku re re la'ang de @46a *//
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa'i sku thams cad las de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku re re la'ang de @46a *//
translated: And in every single body of the emanation body of the tathagata,

original: snyed de snyed kyi dbu mnga' bar gyur la /
analyzed: snyed de snyed kyi dbu mnga' bar gyur la /
translated: he has that many heads.

original: gzhung de bzhin du sku re re la'ang de snyed de snyed kyi ljags mnga' bar gyur te /
analyzed: gzhung de bzhin du sku re re la'ang de snyed de snyed kyi ljags mnga' bar gyur te /
translated: And in the same way, in every single head, he has that many tongues.

original: ljags re re las kyang de snyed de snyed kyi dbyangs kyi yan lag dang / sgra skad kyi gsung chos kyi dbyings ma lus pa'i sems can gyi khams thams cad go bar mdzad pa byung la /
analyzed: ljags re re las kyang de snyed de snyed kyi dbyangs kyi yan lag dang / sgra skad kyi gsung chos kyi dbyings ma lus pa'i sems can gyi khams thams cad go bar mdzad pa byung la /
translated: From each of those tongues, that many and more melodious branches of speech and sounds of speech arose, and those sounds of speech pervaded the entire realm of phenomena.

original: dbyangs kyi yan lag dang / sgra skad kyi gsung de dag re res kyang de snyed de snyed kyi mdo sde bshad par gyur la /
analyzed: dbyangs kyi yan lag dang / sgra skad kyi gsung de dag re res kyang de snyed de snyed kyi mdo sde bshad par gyur la /
translated: Each of those melodious branches of speech and sounds of speech explained that many and more sūtras.

original: mdo sde de dag re re la yang de snyed de snyed kyi chos bstan pa la rab tu gzhol ba mdzad de /
analyzed: mdo sde de dag re re la yang de snyed de snyed kyi chos bstan pa la rab tu gzhol ba mdzad de /
translated: Each of those sūtras was dedicated to teaching that many and more Dharma teachings.

original: chos bstan pa de dag re re las kyang de snyed de snyed kyi chos kyi tshig dang / yi ge brjod par gyur la /
analyzed: chos bstan pa de dag re re las kyang de snyed de snyed kyi chos kyi tshig dang / yi ge brjod par gyur la /
translated: Each of those Dharma teachings was expressed with that many and more Dharma words and letters.

original: chos kyi tshig dang yi ge de dag re res kyang chos kyi dbyings ma lus pa thams cad dbyangs kyi rgyas par bkang ste /
analyzed: chos kyi tshig dang yi ge de dag re res kyang chos kyi dbyings ma lus pa thams cad dbyangs kyi rgyas par bkang ste /
translated: Each of those Dharma words and letters filled the entire realm of phenomena with sound.

original: sems can gyi khams ma lus pa thams cad go bar mdzad kyang /
analyzed: sems can gyi khams ma lus pa thams cad go bar mdzad kyang /
translated: They pervaded the entire realm of sentient beings.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbyangs la dub ba mi mnga' ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbyangs la dub ba mi mnga' ste /
translated: The speech of the tathagatas is never exhausted.

original: nyams par mi 'gyur la thogs pa mi mnga' zhing dma' bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: nyams par mi 'gyur la thogs pa mi mnga' zhing dma' bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: It is never impaired, never obstructed, and never diminished.

original: de lta bu'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor yang bskal pa phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa'i bar du rgyun 'chad par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta bu'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor yang bskal pa phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa'i bar du rgyun 'chad par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Even though they turn the wheel of Dharma in this way, it never ceases until the end of time.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi mthu bo che chen po'i stobs /
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi mthu bo che chen po'i stobs /
translated: This is the great power of the buddhas, the bhagavats.

original: sangs rgyas kyi spyod pa'i rgyal mtshan gyi chos lnga pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi spyod pa'i rgyal mtshan gyi chos lnga pa'o //
translated: This is the fifth attribute of the buddhas.

original: gzhan yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams @46b ni thugs dpal gyi be'us brgyan pa rdo rje chen po ltar shin tu bstan par grub pa mnga' ba dag ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams @46b ni thugs dpal gyi be'us brgyan pa rdo rje chen po ltar shin tu bstan par grub pa mnga' ba dag ste /
translated: “Moreover, the buddhas, the bhagavats, are adorned with the auspicious mark of the heart, which is as firm as a great vajra.

original: de dag byang chub kyi shing drung du byon na bdud sdig to can gyi sems can thams cad snyed kyi bdud kyi sde gzugs sna tshogs can shin tu mi sdug pa /
analyzed: de dag byang chub kyi shing drung du byon na bdud sdig to can gyi sems can thams cad snyed kyi bdud kyi sde gzugs sna tshogs can shin tu mi sdug pa /
translated: When they approach the foot of the Bodhi tree, they are confronted by the entire army of Mara, which is as large as all the sentient beings in the universe. The army of Mara is of various forms and is extremely terrifying.

original: 'jigs 'jigs ltar 'dug pa rab tu sdang ba'i gzugs can /
analyzed: 'jigs 'jigs ltar 'dug pa rab tu sdang ba'i gzugs can /
translated: They are terrifying, with very wrathful forms.

original: ba spu gcig kyang g-yo ba med do //
analyzed: ba spu gcig kyang g-yo ba med do //
translated: most terrifying,🔽most terrifying

original: thugs kyi cha shas shin tu phra ba 'ga' tsam gyis kyang de ltar rnam pa tha dad pa'i gzugs la mtshan ma rnam pa tha dad pa 'dzin pa mi mnga' ste /
analyzed: thugs kyi cha shas shin tu phra ba 'ga' tsam gyis kyang de ltar rnam pa tha dad pa'i gzugs la mtshan ma rnam pa tha dad pa 'dzin pa mi mnga' ste /
translated: Even with a very small part of his mind, he does not apprehend different characteristics in different forms.
